AARGetContactData.title: AARGetContactData
parameters: contactId: Number - ID of individual contact event (as returned by AARGetContacts).
return_value: 0 - Number: Time of the engagement start in mission time (same as the time command).
1 - Number: Time of the engagement end in mission time (same as the time command).
3 - String: Class name of the unit that was shooting.
4 - String: Display name of the vehicle shooter from firing from, followed by the crew position (for example, "M1A1-AIM/D Gunner "). If the shooter is on foot, an empty string is returned.
5 - String: Profile name of the unit that was shooting (if not applicable, or used on AI, then "").
6 - String: Group of the unit that was shooting.
7 - Object: Vehicle of the unit that was shooting (if unit is dismounted, then shooter unit).
8 - String: Class name of the vehicle the shooting unit was in (empty for infantry units).

9 - Array: Contains either a [String, Array], for gunners, indicating crew role and turret path ["Turret",[0]], or, for other positions, just a String, indicating crew role (for example, ["Driver"]). If not in vehicle, then [""].
10 - PositionASL: Shooter position in world coordinates.
11 - String: Class name of ammunition used.
12 - String: Class name of weapon used.
13 - Number: Number of shots fired during the contact.
14 - Number: Number of shots which hit the target.
15 - Object: Target that was shot at (Unit, if the target is an empty vehicle, then objNull).
16 - String: Class name of the unit that was being fired at.
17 - String: Display name of the unit that was fired at (if not applicable, then "").
18 - String: Profile name of the unit that was fired at (if not applicable, or for AI, then "").
19 - String: Group of the unit that was fired at.
20 - Object: Vehicle of the unit that was fired at (for infantry units, it is the unit itself; for vehicle targets, it is objNull).
21 - String: Class name of the vehicle that was fired at.

22 - Array: Contains either a [String, Array], for gunners, indicating crew role and turret path ["Turret",[0]], or, for other positions, just a String, indicating crew role (for example, ["Driver"]). If not in vehicle or the vehicle itself is the target, then [""].
23 - PositionASL: Target position in world coordinates.
24 - Number: Total damage shooter inflicted upon target during the contact.
25 - Number: Damage status of the target at the end of the event.
26 - Position3D: Position of the selection that was hit in coordinates relative to the target origin (default: [0,0,0]).
27 - Number: Shooter number (the number that is used, when addressing a subordinate).
29 - String: ObjToIdEx of the shooter unit.
30 - String: ObjToIdEx of the target unit.
31 - String: ObjToIdEx of the shooter vehicle (returns the unit, if not in vehicle).
32 - String: ObjToIdEx of the target vehicle (returns the unit, if not in vehicle).

AARGetEngagementStat.title: AARGetEngagementStat
parameters: element: Object, Side - Data Type or Group - Entity for which to return statistics.

type: String - Type of statistic to return. Possible types are:"roundsFired" - Number of rounds fired."enemyKilled" - Number of enemies killed."friendlyKilled" - Number of friendly units killed."enemyWounded" - Number of wounded enemy units."friendlyWounded" - Number of wounded friendly units.The following statistics are available in V2.08+:"engagementRange" - Mean value of distances during engagements with other units / vehicles."fuelExpanded" - How much fuel a unit used, while driving vehicles."killed" - How many times a unit was killed."ranDistance" - Distance the unit traveled by foot."timeToEngage" - Mean value of the number of times between a unit spotting an enemy and engaging it."wounded" - How many times a unit was wounded.
"roundsFired" - Number of rounds fired.
"enemyKilled" - Number of enemies killed.
"friendlyKilled" - Number of friendly units killed.
"enemyWounded" - Number of wounded enemy units.
"friendlyWounded" - Number of wounded friendly units.The following statistics are available in V2.08+:
"engagementRange" - Mean value of distances during engagements with other units / vehicles.
"fuelExpanded" - How much fuel a unit used, while driving vehicles.
"killed" - How many times a unit was killed.
"ranDistance" - Distance the unit traveled by foot.
"timeToEngage" - Mean value of the number of times between a unit spotting an enemy and engaging it.
"wounded" - How many times a unit was wounded.
engagementId: Number - Index of engagement to evaluate (as returned by getEngagementIds).

addAction.title: addAction
addAction.docSyntax: holder addAction [title, filename, arguments, priority, showWindow, hideOnUse, shortcut, condition]
parameters: holder: Object - Object to assign the action to
title: String - The action name which is displayed in the action menu.
filename: String - Path to the script that is called when the action is activated. Relative to the mission folder.
arguments: Anything - Extra data to pass to the script (will be (_this select 3) for the script) (optional)

priority: Number - Priority value of the action (determines how high it appears in the action menu). Actions will be arranged descending according to this. Every game action has a preset priority value. Value can be negative. Actions with same values will be arranged in order which they were made, newest at the bottom. (optional)

showWindow: Boolean - If set true, action menu will appear on screen as soon as action is available. If false, action will still be added to menu, but will not cause it to appear if hidden.  (optional)
hideOnUse: Boolean - If set to true, the action menu will hide itself after action is used. If false, action menu will stay open and on selected action after use. (optional)
shortcut: String - VBS  Key Actions that will activate action. DIK KeyCodes can also be used. Use empty string for no shortcut (""). (optional)

condition: String - (optional, default true) Code that must return true for action to be shown. Variables "_target" (object action is attached to) and "_this" (executing unit) can be used in the evaluation. (optional)
return_value: Number - Index of the added action. Used to remove the action with removeAction

addCollisionEventHandler.title: addCollisionEventHandler
parameters: object: Object - Object to receive the event handler.
component: String - Selection name (must exist in the Geometry LOD, and must not be in the notation "Component ##")

code: String - Code that should be executed, when the event occurs. The code is passed data in the _this variable, which contains: [object with event handler, component name, object it collided with, collision enter / exit]

repeat: Boolean - Repeats the event call during the duration of the collision.If repeat is set to true, then the supplied code is executed each frame, while there is a collision with the component. When the collision with a component ends, the code is called with parameter 4 set to false, to indicate there is no longer any more collision with the component, and parameter 3 is null.If repeat is set to false, then the code is only executed upon entering the collision, and on exiting the collision. This is the recommend method of using addCollisionEventHandler for a component, considering that the script does not need to constantly monitor the collision between two objects. When a collision occurs for the first time, parameter 4 passed to the _this array is set to true, to indicate collision entrance. When the collisions stops, parameter 4 passed to _this is false, and parameter 3 is Variables - Null, to indicate there is no longer a collision with the component.

If repeat is set to true, then the supplied code is executed each frame, while there is a collision with the component. When the collision with a component ends, the code is called with parameter 4 set to false, to indicate there is no longer any more collision with the component, and parameter 3 is null.

If repeat is set to false, then the code is only executed upon entering the collision, and on exiting the collision. This is the recommend method of using addCollisionEventHandler for a component, considering that the script does not need to constantly monitor the collision between two objects. When a collision occurs for the first time, parameter 4 passed to the _this array is set to true, to indicate collision entrance. When the collisions stops, parameter 4 passed to _this is false, and parameter 3 is Variables - Null, to indicate there is no longer a collision with the component.
return_value: Number - Event handler index (to be used with removeCollisionEventHandler)

addEventHandler.title: addEventHandler
parameters: target: Object, Group, or Side - Data Type - Indicates what receives the event handler (most events are added to an Object, except when noted otherwise).
type: String - Event handler type (see Category VBS Event Handlers for options).
code: String or Code - Code to execute, once the event occurs. The code receives the event data in the _this variable, depending on the event type.

parameters: Array -  List of parameters to pass to the event handler. The parameters are specific to the type of event handler added, and need to be specified by name as a string, followed by the value. For example, ["PARAM1", value1, "PARAM2", value2...]. Each available parameter is optional, and if not specified, has a default value (optional) (V18.3+).

addResistiveForce.title: addResistiveForce
addResistiveForce.docSyntax: vehicle addResistiveForce [id, position, forceCoefficient, minForce, maxForce]
parameters: vehicle: Object - Vehicle to add force to. Only vehicles of type CarEPE and TankEPE are supported.
id: String - Unique ID of this force. Any subsequent calls to addResistiveForce with the same ID updates this force.
position: String OR Vector3D - Position on the vehicle at which to apply the force. Can be either a memory point name or model coordinates.
forceCoefficient: Vector3D - Defines coefficients that the resistive force is multiplied by in each local axis. Larger values create more resistance.
minForce: Vector3D - Defines the minimum amount of force that can be applied in each local axis. Negative values define the maximum force in the negative direction of the axis.
maxForce: Vector3D - Defines the maximum amount of force that can be applied in each local axis. Negative values define the minimum force in the negative direction of the axis.

animate.title: animate
animate.docSyntax: object animate [animationName, phase, duration, sound, override]
parameters: object: Object - The object.

animationName: String - Name of the animation (the class name of the animation, defined in the addon config.cpp). Some in-game objects have animation names that end with _hide, those cause the animated element to be hidden, once a certain animation threshold has been reached (for doors, it is normally 1).

phase: Number - The animation phase (see animationPhase) the selected part should be set to. The range is normally between 0 and 1, but some animations could be configured for different ranges (use getAnimInfo to find the applicable values). The speed in which the animation is processed, is defined in the addon config.cpp and cannot be changed during the mission.
duration: Number - How long should the whole animation take to finish (from 0 to 1) (optional, default: 0, V1.40+).

sound: Array - Sound to be played during the animation (optional, default: [], V1.50+).The array contains the following parameters:soundClass: String - Class name that is defined in CfgSounds (see Class CfgSounds in the VBS Developer Reference).soundLength: Number - Duration in seconds to take to play the full sound file. Passing -1 does not modify the sound file duration (default: -1).matchAnimPhase: Boolean - If true, the sound file start location is synchronized with the animation current phase. For example, if the animation phase is 0.5, then the sound file starts half way through. Also, when the animation finishes, the sound file stops playing. If set to false, then the sound file starts from the very beginning, and the length is defined by soundLength parameter.matchAnimLength: Boolean - If true, the sound file length is set to the animPeriod only if animPeriod is greater than zero. Otherwise, if still true, and animPeriod is less than or equal to zero, the sound file is played with an animation length of 1 second. If false, the sound file length is unmodified and soundLength is used to define the sound file length.publicBroadcast: Boolean - If true, the command is broadcast to all multiplayer clients. If false, the sound file is only heard on the computer, where the object is local.
soundClass: String - Class name that is defined in CfgSounds (see Class CfgSounds in the VBS Developer Reference).
soundLength: Number - Duration in seconds to take to play the full sound file. Passing -1 does not modify the sound file duration (default: -1).

matchAnimPhase: Boolean - If true, the sound file start location is synchronized with the animation current phase. For example, if the animation phase is 0.5, then the sound file starts half way through. Also, when the animation finishes, the sound file stops playing. If set to false, then the sound file starts from the very beginning, and the length is defined by soundLength parameter.

matchAnimLength: Boolean - If true, the sound file length is set to the animPeriod only if animPeriod is greater than zero. Otherwise, if still true, and animPeriod is less than or equal to zero, the sound file is played with an animation length of 1 second. If false, the sound file length is unmodified and soundLength is used to define the sound file length.
publicBroadcast: Boolean - If true, the command is broadcast to all multiplayer clients. If false, the sound file is only heard on the computer, where the object is local.

override: Boolean - Allows the control of engine-driven animations. When the override parameter is true, a new animation source is created to control the selected animation. This animation is then no longer controlled by the engine. The original behavior can be restored by setting this parameter to false (optional, default: false, V3.7+).

animateSource.title: animateSource
animateSource.docSyntax: object animateSource [sourceName, phase, duration, sound, override]
parameters: object: Object - The object.
sourceName: String - The name of the animation source to control (for example, "rpm", "gear").

phase: Number - The animation phase (see animationPhase) the selected part should be set to. The range is normally between 0 and 1, but some animations could be configured for different ranges (use getAnimInfo to find the applicable values). The speed in which the animation is processed, is defined in the addon config.cpp and cannot be changed during the mission.
duration: Number - How long should the whole animation take to finish (from 0 to 1) (optional, default: 0).

sound: Array - Sound to play during the animation (optional, default: []).The array contains the following parameters:soundClass: String - Class name that is defined in CfgSounds (see Class CfgSounds in the VBS Developer Reference).soundLength: Number - Duration in seconds to play the sound file. Passing -1 does not modify the sound file duration (default: -1).matchAnimPhase: Boolean - If true, the sound file start location is synchronized with the animation current phase. For example, if the animation phase is 0.5, then the sound file starts half way through. Also, when the animation finishes, the sound file stops playing. If set to false, then the sound file starts from the very beginning, and the length is defined by the soundLength parameter.matchAnimLength: Boolean - If true, the sound file length is set to the animPeriod only if the animPeriod is greater than zero. Otherwise, if still true, and animPeriod is less than or equal to zero, the sound file is played with an animation length of 1 second. If false, sound file length is untouched and soundLength is used to define the sound file length.publicBroadcast: Boolean - If true, the command is broadcast to all multiplayer clients. If false, the sound file is only heard on the computer where the object is local.
soundClass: String - Class name that is defined in CfgSounds (see Class CfgSounds in the VBS Developer Reference).
soundLength: Number - Duration in seconds to play the sound file. Passing -1 does not modify the sound file duration (default: -1).

matchAnimPhase: Boolean - If true, the sound file start location is synchronized with the animation current phase. For example, if the animation phase is 0.5, then the sound file starts half way through. Also, when the animation finishes, the sound file stops playing. If set to false, then the sound file starts from the very beginning, and the length is defined by the soundLength parameter.

matchAnimLength: Boolean - If true, the sound file length is set to the animPeriod only if the animPeriod is greater than zero. Otherwise, if still true, and animPeriod is less than or equal to zero, the sound file is played with an animation length of 1 second. If false, sound file length is untouched and soundLength is used to define the sound file length.
publicBroadcast: Boolean - If true, the command is broadcast to all multiplayer clients. If false, the sound file is only heard on the computer where the object is local.

override: Boolean - Allows the control of engine-driven animations. When the override parameter is true, a new animation source is created to control the selected animation. This animation is then no longer controlled by the engine. The original behavior can be restored by setting this parameter to false (optional, default: false).

Be aware that in V3.0+, the status returned is still "SP_SELECT_MISSION" for a while, when checked in init.sqf, so it is best to use waitUntil to check for the correct status)"MISSION_INTERUPT" (interrupt menu - Continue / Save / Abort)"MP_CLIENT_GET_READY" (client is in the Briefing phase, before the actual mission start) (V2.10+)"MP_CLIENT_WAITING""MP_PARTICIPANTS""MP_SELECT_ROLE""MP_SELECT_SERVER""MP_SERVER_GET_READY""MP_SERVER_SELECT_MISSION""OME""OME_PREVIEW""OME_SELECT_ISLAND""OPTIONS""OPTIONS_AUDIO""OPTIONS_CONTROLS""OPTIONS_DIFFICULTY""OPTIONS_VIDEO""RTE""RTE_PREVIEW""SP_SELECT_MISSION" (in the Mission Selection menu, see "MISSION" for V3.0+ behavior)"SHUTDOWN" (user closes VBS, and it shuts down) (V3.9+)

"MISSION" (a mission has been started from the Training Scenarios menu. Be aware that in V3.0+, the status returned is still "SP_SELECT_MISSION" for a while, when checked in init.sqf, so it is best to use waitUntil to check for the correct status)

attachTo.title: attachTo
attachTo.docSyntax: child attachTo [parent, offset, mempoint, rope, bone, collisions]
parameters: child: Object - Object to be attached.
parent: Object - Object that the child is attached to. In V3.2+, objects can be attached to simulated proxies, by using the getProxy command.
offset: Position3D - Positional offset to either the object center or the memory point. If no offset is specified, the object is attached with the current position it is placed at (optional).
mempoint: String - Parent object Memory point (see Memory LOD in the VBS Developer Reference) (optional).

rope: Number or Boolean - Can be:0 or false: The attachment is rigid, meaning the child object is fixed in position relatively to the parent object (default: false).1 or true: The attachment is done using a flexible rope, allowing the child object to swing about.2: The object is attached using an inflexible link (such as a tow bar, with pivots on each end).3: The object is attached using a horizontal rope (to simulate towing). If the model has a "attachRope" memory point, then the rope is attached to this point.
0 or false: The attachment is rigid, meaning the child object is fixed in position relatively to the parent object (default: false).
1 or true: The attachment is done using a flexible rope, allowing the child object to swing about.
2: The object is attached using an inflexible link (such as a tow bar, with pivots on each end).
3: The object is attached using a horizontal rope (to simulate towing). If the model has a "attachRope" memory point, then the rope is attached to this point.
bone: String - Name of bone to attach to on the parent object. The referenced bone must be of a "Memory", "Geometry", or "Fire" LOD (optional, available in V1.24+).
collisions: Boolean - Whether collisions for attached object should be enabled (optional, default: false, V1.40+).

calculateLineOfSight.title: calculateLineOfSight
parameters: unit: Object - Unit (or object) around which to check.
radius: Number - Maximum radius to check.

rays: Number - Number of "rays" to use, when checking. The 360-degree circle around the player is divided by this number, to determine the ray positions (for example, a value of 36 creates one ray every 10 degrees). Larger numbers create more accurate results, but at the cost of CPU cycles (optional, default: 50).
samples: Number - How many samples to check on each ray. Larger numbers create more accurate results, but at the cost of CPU cycles (optional, default: 20).
format: String - Output format. Can be "LL", "MGRS", "LLMS", "UTM", or "UTMB" (optional, default: game positions).
return_value: Array of Array - Polygons defining visible and invisible areas (see description).

camCreate.title: camCreate
parameters: type: String - Can be:"camera" - Regular camera."camcontruct" - Player-controlled "construction" camera. Movement limits are defined by camConstuctionSetParams. Maximum initial height is 30m above ground (V2.00)."seagull" - Camera that moves like a bird (for example, banking while turning). Seagull cameras cannot have "targets" (they can only look in the direction they are moving)."camFree" - Camera that behaves like the 3D camera in the OME / RTE (V3.8+).
"camera" - Regular camera.
"camcontruct" - Player-controlled "construction" camera. Movement limits are defined by camConstuctionSetParams. Maximum initial height is 30m above ground (V2.00).
"seagull" - Camera that moves like a bird (for example, banking while turning). Seagull cameras cannot have "targets" (they can only look in the direction they are moving).
"camFree" - Camera that behaves like the 3D camera in the OME / RTE (V3.8+).
position: Position-2 - Position to create the object at.

cameraEffect.title: cameraEffect
parameters: camera: Object - Object of type "camera".

name: String - Effect type. Can be:"INTERNAL": Camera can be moved around, and otherwise manipulated."EXTERNAL": (same as "INTERNAL"?)"FIXED": Fixed position (azimuth: 0)"FIXEDWITHZOOM": Fixed position & zoom (camSetFov: .1)"TERMINATE": Exit the current camera view and switch back to the player view.
"INTERNAL": Camera can be moved around, and otherwise manipulated.
"EXTERNAL": (same as "INTERNAL"?)
"FIXED": Fixed position (azimuth: 0)
"FIXEDWITHZOOM": Fixed position & zoom (camSetFov: .1)
"TERMINATE": Exit the current camera view and switch back to the player view.

position: String - Position of the effect. One of"BACK": (normally used)"LEFT", "RIGHT", "TOP", "FRONT": (Related to"Fixed" and "FixedWithZoom" camera effects. When used on a target instead of a camera it will set the direction where the camera is.)

captureStart.title: captureStart
captureStart.docSyntax: captureStart [filename, width, height, framerate, codecs, sound, ui, buffersize, thread, cliprectangle]
parameters: filename: String - Path to save video in (backslashes need to be specified in the following way: for example, "O:\\fp\\vbs-video.avi"). If the path does not contain a backslash, it is regarded as a relative path with respect to $HOME\Documents\VBS2\videos. Files are recorded in the AVI video-file format. If no file extension is used, an .avi file is appended to the path automatically. If "live" (V3.8.1+) is used instead of a path, live streaming is started, and when "live" is used and the resolution specified by width and height is higher than the limit of 480K (for example, 800x600), then the resolution is down-scaled to that limit. You can stream to a port, using "live:<portNumber>" (for example, "live:9534") (the default port is 11234).Note: If the specified file already exists, the existing file is overwritten by the new one, without any warning. Also, in V19.1.0+, if the file size exceeds 3.5GB, the file is split into several files.
width: Number - Capture video width (optional, default: 640, has to be a multiple of 4).
height: Number - Captured video height (optional, default: 480, has to be a multiple of 4).
framerate: Number - Frames / seconds. The recommended value is between 20-25 (optional, default: 20).

codecs: Array - List of codecs (set by their standard four letter names: ["MPG4", "DIVX", "XVID", "MPG2", "MPG1", "MJPG", "MSVC"]) that are tried one by one (even if the codecs parameter is omitted). If none works, raw data ("RAW") is written (optional).Note: The MSVC codec is generally available in Windows. However, it produces low-quality video.
sound: Number - Record sound on / off (optional, default: 1).
ui: Number - Record video with UI shown / hidden (optional, default: 1).

buffersize: Number - Buffer size in MB. Can be up-to 100MB. It is not necessary to use such a large amount unless raw data is saved (when no codec is used). In those cases, the buffer helps for the periods of disk writes. For example, the raw data case works well with framerate set to 10 and buffersize set to 100 (optional, default: 10).
thread: Number - Obsolete in V1.30+. A worker thread can be used for the video encoding task. Disable it by setting the argument to 0 (optional, default: 1).

cliprectangle: Array - Rectangular area of screen that is streamed instead of the whole screen. The whole screen is streamed, if cliprectangle is not specified. The rectangular area is specified by an array containing exactly 4 non-negative numbers: origin_X, origin_Y, width, and height of the rectangle (in screen coordinates). If the given rectangle is partly outside the screen, it is clipped to fit the screen. If the given rectangle is completely outside the screen or if the rectangle area is zero, clipping is stopped and streaming of the whole screen begins (optional, default: none) (V17.4.0+).
return_value: Boolean - Returns false, when already recording.

Z_speed: Number - Vertical speed (in degrees per second). Positive values cause upward movements, while negative values cause downward movement. 0 stops any vertical movement.

Z_accel: Boolean - If true, then the configured acceleration speed is used to reach the specified Z_speed. If false, then the specified Z_speed is reached immediately, without accelerating (default: false, the [X_accel,Z_accel] array is optional).

0: Single only
1: Burst only

3: Auto only

range: Number - Range of the indirect damage.

craters: Boolean - Disable creation of crater. Particle effects depend on the craters parameter. By disabling craters, particles are also disabled, but disabling particles does not have any effect on craters (optional, default: false).
nodamage: Boolean - Disable damage effects on all objects (optional, default: false).
nodamageentities: Boolean - Disable damage effects on units and vehicles only. Overrides nodamage (optional, default: false).

createRope.title: createRope
createRope.docSyntax: createRope [fromObject, fromPoint, toObject, toPoint, ropeClassName, ropeBeg, ropeEnd, ropeSegments, [swingSpring, twistSpring, damping], collision, masscoef, maxlengthcoef, breakforce]
parameters: fromObject: Object - Object to start creating a rope from.
fromPoint: String or Vector3D - Specifies where on the object the rope should start, either a string (name of memory point) or an array of three numbers (vector in model coordinates).
toObject: Object - Object to attach last segment of rope to.
toPoint: String or Vector3D - Specifies where on the object the rope should finish, either a string (name of memory point) or an array of three numbers (vector in model coordinates).
ropeClassName: String - Name of class that will be created and that will represent a rope segment. Can be "vbs2_rope_segment","vbs2_rope_segment_0_6", or "vbs2_rope_segment_1_2".
ropeBeg: String or Vector3D - Position on rope that will connect with the previous segment (either memory point name or vector - similar to fromPoint)
ropeEnd: String or Vector3D - Position on rope that will connect with the next segment (either memory point name or vector - similar to fromPoint)
ropeSegments: Number - Number of segments to be created
swingSpring: Number - Spring created in swing directions, from interval <0, inf), 0 means no spring will be used
twistSpring: Number - Spring created in twist directions, from interval <0, inf), 0 means no spring will be used

damping: Number - Damping simulates environmental (air) friction and can be used for stabilizing the rope perpetual swinging, from interval <0, inf), 0 means no damping, reasonable values are around 0.2
collision: Boolean - Disables collision between rope and attached vehicles and collisions between individual rope segments (Optional, default: true) (V1.31+)
masscoef: Number - (Optional, default: 1.0) (V1.42+)

maxlengthcoef: Number - Stability of the rope can be increased by setting maxLengthCoef. A value of 1.05 means that the rope can stretch by 5% over its max length. 0 disables this technology. This parameter can't be used on breakable ropes - If the rope is breakable (breakforce is set), then this parameter is ignored. (Optional, default: 0) (V1.34+)
breakforce: Number - When forces acting on rope's joints exceeds breakForce the rope will break. Value less or equal to zero disables this technology. (Optional) (V1.40+)
return_value: Array - Two nested arrays with created rope segments.

parameters: ammotype: String - Class name of ammunition (see the ammo parameter in Magazine Parameters in the VBS Developer Reference) to create.
position: Position3D - Position at which the shot is created.
velocity: Vector3D - Velocity [x, y ,z] at which the ammunition travels.
sound: String - Class name of weapon (see Weapon Configuration in the VBS Developer Reference), whose sound to play when the shot is created (optional, default: "") (V1.61+).
tracer: Boolean - If true, then a tracer shot is created (V2.00+).

createWaterDisturbance.title: createWaterDisturbance
parameters: position: Position2D - Must only contain the [x,y] coordinates. Otherwise, the command does not work.

amplitude: Number - Strength of surface ripples (not the wave height itself - the height is always the same). The higher the number, the smoother the surface. Approximate range for realistic effects: -10 to 10 (a positive value creates a wave that is higher than the water surface, a negative value causes it to be lower, but in practical terms, the difference is nearly impossible to distinguish).

speed: Number - Speed at which wave spreads (in m/sec), applied to the diameter of the circular wave, so the actual speed at which a wave moves into one direction is twice the specified value. Approximate range for realistic effects: 0.2 to 1.
duration: Number - For how long the wave should spread out (in seconds). When reaching the last 20% of the specified time, the wave starts to fade out.

cylinderCollision.title: cylinderCollision
cylinderCollision.docSyntax: cylinderCollision [startpos, endpos, radius, ignore, lod, density]
parameters: startpos: PositionASL - Start collision position.
endpos: PositionASL - End collision position.
radius: Number - Cylinder radius (Ii set to 0, only a single ray is used).
ignore: Object - Object that is ignored in the collision path.
lod: String - LOD (see LODs in the VBS Developer Reference) to consider in collision detection. Can be: "FIRE", "VIEW", "GEOM", or "IFIRE" (indirect fire).
density: Number - Spacing between cast rays.
return_value: PositionASL (In V1.23+, a 6-member array is returned, containing [x, z, y, nx, nz, ny], where the n* values represent the normal vector coordinates of the hit surface) - Location of collision between end points. If there are no obstructions between end points, then the end position is returned, along with a normal vector of [0,0,0].

diag_captureMemory.title: diag_captureMemory
parameters: mode: String - Low-level memory profiling mode. Can be:"start" - Has the same effect as -memoryProfilingLowLevel, attaching to the memory-related system functions. If the profiler starts with -memoryProfilingLowLevel=buffer_size, the last specified value is used (not the default buffer size of 40000 MB)."stop" -  Stops profiling, unattaching from all system functions."snapshot" - Takes a memory snapshot (a point in time from which you want to analyze memory changes)."dump" - Dumps the allocated memory, since the last snapshot was taken, as a memory tree into a log file (stored as memoryDATE.txt, where DATE is the current date, at the root of the VBS3 installation folder)."dumpMemory" - Dumps all memory allocations, since the first start of the profiler, as a memory tree into a log file (stored as memoryDATE.txt, where DATE is the current date, at the root of the VBS3 installation folder).

"start" - Has the same effect as -memoryProfilingLowLevel, attaching to the memory-related system functions. If the profiler starts with -memoryProfilingLowLevel=buffer_size, the last specified value is used (not the default buffer size of 40000 MB).
"stop" -  Stops profiling, unattaching from all system functions.
"snapshot" - Takes a memory snapshot (a point in time from which you want to analyze memory changes).

"dump" - Dumps the allocated memory, since the last snapshot was taken, as a memory tree into a log file (stored as memoryDATE.txt, where DATE is the current date, at the root of the VBS3 installation folder).

"dumpMemory" - Dumps all memory allocations, since the first start of the profiler, as a memory tree into a log file (stored as memoryDATE.txt, where DATE is the current date, at the root of the VBS3 installation folder).

diag_perfCap.title: diag_perfCap
parameters: section: String - Profile scope name. If empty, logging is switched off.
threshold: Number - Threshold (in seconds) that has to be exceeded, in order to start logging.

diag_setMapScale.title: diag_setMapScale
parameters: min: Number - Smallest scale map can be zoomed to (largest magnification) (default: 0.001).
max: Number - Highest scale map can be zoomed to (smallest magnification) (default: 1).
default: Number - Default scale the map is displayed at, when opened (default: .1).

diag_setMaxBandwidth.title: diag_setMaxBandwidth
parameters: bandwidth: Number - The bandwidth in bits/second.

diagMessage.title: diagMessage
parameters: handle: String - Handle that identifies an existing message. By using the same handle as an existing message, the text can be updated (-1 means new message).

duration: Number - How long (in milliseconds) the message is displayed. In order to update the same message, display the first with the longest duration practical (the limit for the command is around 4000000, which is a little over one hour).
message: String - Message displayed.

dialog.title: dialog
return_value: Boolean - Returns true, if a dialog is open; false, if not.

difficultyEnabled.title: difficultyEnabled
parameters: option: String - Difficulty value (as listed in setDifficulty).

direction.title: direction
parameters: object: Object or Location - Object or location.
return_value: Number - Direction in degrees, range 0 to 360

directSay.title: directSay
parameters: unit: Object - The unit.
message: String - The message.

dirToVector.title: dirToVector
parameters: azimuth: Number - Compass direction.
elevation: Number - Degrees above horizontal (optional: default 0).

disableActions.title: disableActions
parameters: object: Object - Object with assigned actions
disable: Boolean - If true, actions will be disabled. false will re-enable actions.

disableAI.title: disableAI
parameters: unit: Unit - AI unit.
skilltype: String - AI skill to manipulate (see description).

disableAnimationMove.title: disableAnimationMove
parameters: unit: Object - Unit to check.

disableConversation.title: disableConversation
parameters: unitName: Object
disable: Boolean

disableFireArc.title: disableFireArc
parameters: vehicle: Object - Vehicle on which the turret is located.
turret: Array - Turret for which the arc is set.

disableGeo.title: disableGeo
disableGeo.docSyntax: object disableGeo [visibility, fire, view, collision, roadways, shadows]
parameters: object: Object - The object.
visibility: Boolean - Toggles object visibility.
fire: Boolean - Toggles object fire geometry.
view: Boolean - Toggles object view geometry.
collision: Boolean - Toggles object collision geometry.
roadways: Boolean - Toggles object roadways (V1.50+).
shadows: Boolean - Toggles object shadows (V1.50+).

disableGunnerInput.title: disableGunnerInput
parameters: vehicle: Object - Vehicle with turrets
turret: Array - Turret path
disable: Boolean - If true, AI will not control turret anymore.
notstabilized: Boolean - If true, turret stabilization is off. (V1.50)

disableParachute.title: disableParachute
parameters: unit: Object - Unit to remove the parachute capability from.
disable: Boolean - If true, then no parachute can be used; false only enables parachutes, if the unit is not in free fall.

disableRendering.title: disableRendering
parameters: render: Boolean - If true, no 3D objects are rendered.

disableTIEquipment.title: disableTIEquipment
parameters: vehicle: Object
state: Boolean - true to turn TI off, false to turn TI on

disableUserInput.title: disableUserInput
parameters: state: Boolean - If true, input is disabled, false otherwise.

disableVON.title: disableVON
parameters: status: Boolean - If true enables VON, false disables VON.

disableWeaponControl.title: disableWeaponControl
disableWeaponControl.docSyntax: vehicle disableWeaponControl [turret, move, optics, fire, reload]
parameters: vehicle: Object - Either a vehicle with turrets, or an armed soldier.
turret: Array - Path for vehicle turret. Ignored for units.
move: Boolean - If true, then vehicle turret cannot be moved. Has no effect on units.
optics: Boolean - If true, then only iron sights can be used.
fire: Boolean - If true, then weapon cannot be fired.
reload: Boolean - If true, then weapon cannot be reloaded.

displayAddEventHandler.title: displayAddEventHandler
parameters: display: Display - Display which supports the specific event handler.
event: String - VBS User Interface Event Handlers to define (without the "on" prefix).
command: String - Command(s) to execute at the defined event.
return_value: Number - ID of the handler (used with displayRemoveEventHandler), or -1 when adding the handler fails.

displayCtrl.title: displayCtrl
parameters: display: Display - Parent control.
idc: Number - IDC of child control.

displayRemoveAllEventHandlers.title: displayRemoveAllEventHandlers
parameters: display: Display - Display that had an event handler added.
event: String - VBS User Interface Event Handlers to remove (without the "on" prefix).

displayRemoveEventHandler.title: displayRemoveEventHandler
parameters: display: Display - Display that had an event handler added.
event: String - VBS User Interface Event Handlers to remove (without the "on" prefix).
id: Number - Event ID, as returned by displaySetEventHandler or displayAddEventHandler. For handlers added in the dialog itself, or using displaySetEventHandler, 0 can be used.

displaySetEventHandler.title: displaySetEventHandler
parameters: display: Display - Display which supports the specific event handler.
event: String - VBS User Interface Event Handlers to define (without the "on" prefix).
command: String - Command(s) to execute at the defined event.

displayText.title: displayText
displayText.docSyntax: object displayText [message, offset, mode, color, size, index]
parameters: object: Object or Array - Object or position to attach message to (see description).
message: String - Text to display (see description).
offset: Vector3D - Positional offset to object (optional, default:[0,0,0]).

mode: Boolean - Display in 3D or not. In 2D mode text will keep its size, no matter the distance to the player, and will be visible through obstructions. In 3D mode the text size changes depending on the distance to the player, and will be hidden by obstructions (optional, default: false).
color: Color - Text color definition [Red, Green, Blue, Alpha] (optional, default: [1,1,1,1]).
size: Number - Message size (optional, default: 0.2). For 2D text a rather small number should be used (default: 0.02).
index: Number - Multiple messages can be attached to single object by giving them a unique index (optional, default: 0) (V1.54+)
return_value: Number - V1.54+: unique identifier of the created text field. Older versions: no return value

dissolveTeam.title: dissolveTeam
parameters: teamColor: String - Possible team values are: "RED", "GREEN", "BLUE" or "YELLOW".

distance.title: distance
parameters: var1: Object, Location (in VBS2 1.24+) or Array-format Position-2
var2 or pos2: Object, Location (in VBS2 1.24+) or Array-format Position-2

doFire.title: doFire
parameters: unit: Object or Array - Unit(s).
target: Object - The target.

doFollow.title: doFollow
parameters: follower : Object or Array - Unit(s) that follow.
leader: Object - New lead unit.

doFSM.title: doFSM
parameters: unit: Object - Unit that is available as "_units select 0" in the called FSM.
fsmName: String - Name of FSM to execute.
position: Position-2 - 2- or 3-dimensional array, available as "_destination" in the called FSM.
target: Object - Object that is available as "_target" in the called FSM.

doGetOut.title: doGetOut
parameters: unit(s): Object or Array - Unit(s) to get out.

doMove.title: doMove
parameters: unit(s): Object or Array - Unit(s) to move.
position: Array - format Position-2 - Position to move to.

doObservation.title: doObservation
parameters: pos: PositionASL - Center of target box.
dir: Vector3D - vectorDir or target box.
pitch: Vector3D - vectorUp or target box.
size: Array - [x,y,z] size (in m) of target box.
show: Boolean - If true, then target box and aiming paths will be visible to group leader (even if not in editor mode). If false then these indicators are only visible in the editor and AAR.
color: Color - Color of target box.
shooters: Array - Units that should fire at target.
time: Number - Maximum time (in sec) to fire at target. -1 disables time limit. 0 stops ongoing fire. (optional, default: -1)
aim: Number - Whether each unit should find one random position to look at continuously (0), or whether, at random intervals, a new target should be chosen (1). (optional, default: 1)
return_value: Number - Index of observation order (to be used with getObservationArea)

doStop.title: doStop
parameters: unit(s): Object or Array - Unit(s) to stop.

doSuppressiveFire.title: doSuppressiveFire
parameters: pos: PositionASL - Center of target box.
dir: Vector3D - vectorDir or target box.
pitch: Vector3D - vectorUp or target box.
size: Array - [x,y,z] size (in m) of target box.
show: Boolean - If true, then target box and aiming paths will be visible to group leader (even if not in editor mode). If false then these indicators are only visible in the editor and AAR.
color: Color - Color of target box.
shooters: Array - Units that should fire at target.
time: Number - Maximum time (in sec) to fire at target. -1 disables time limit. 0 stops ongoing fire. (optional, default: -1)
ammo: Number - Maximum ratio of ammo that should be used (0-1). -1 disables ammo limit. (optional, default: -1)
mags: Number - Maximum number of magazines that should be used. -1 disables magazine limit. (optional, default: -1)
mode: Number - Firing mode to use. (optional, default: 2) Possible values:0: Single only1: Burst only2: Random switching between single and burst mode3: Auto only
0: Single only
1: Burst only
2: Random switching between single and burst mode
3: Auto only
aim: Number - Whether each unit should find one random position to fire at continuously (0), or whether, at random intervals, a new target should be chosen (1). (optional, default: 1)
return_value: Number - Index of suppressive fire order (to be used with getSuppressiveFire)

doTarget.title: doTarget
parameters: units: Object or Array - Unit(s).
target: Object - The target.

doWatch.title: doWatch
parameters: units: Object or Array - Unit(s).
position: Array - format Position-2 - Position to watch.

drawArrow.title: drawArrow
parameters: map: Control - Map on which to draw the arrow.
position1: Position-2 - Arrow start position.
position2: Position-2 - Arrow end position.
color: Color - Arrow color.

drawEllipse.title: drawEllipse
drawEllipse.docSyntax: map drawEllipse [center, a, b, angle, color, fill]
parameters: map: Control - Map to draw and ellipse on.
center: Position-2 - Center of ellipse.
a: Number - X-radius of ellipse.
b: Number - Y-radius of ellipse.
angle: Number - Angle at which to tile the ellipse.
color: Color - Line color.
fill: String - Either empty ("") to show only the outline, or texture name.

drawFrustum.title: drawFrustum
parameters: unit: Object - Unit for which the frustum setting is returned.
return_value: Array - [mode, size, color] of unit frustum ([0,100,[0,0,1,0.1]], if not defined).

drawGeometry.title: drawGeometry
parameters: area: Array - Defines lower-left X, lower-left Y, upper-right X, and upper-right Y coordinates of a rectangular area.

drawIcon.title: drawIcon
drawIcon.docSyntax: map drawIcon [icon, color, position, width, height, angle, text]
parameters: map: Control - Map control.

icon: String - Icon to display. Can either be a Procedural Textures or a path. If using a procedural color, then all channels should be set to 1 (...color(1,1,1,1)), so that the following 'color' argument will work correctly. If a path is specified, then it can either refer to an absolute path on a local drive (path must start with the drive letter), or to an addon path (no drive letter).
color: Color - Color applied to non-transparent parts of the icon, as well as the 'text' label.
position: Position-2 - Map position where center of the icon will be placed.
width: Number - Horizontal "radius" of icon. See description for details.
height: Number - Vertical "radius" of icon.
angle: Number - Rotation angle (in degrees).
text: String - Text label that is shown beside the icon. (optional, default: "")

drawLine.title: drawLine
parameters: map: Control
position1: Position-2
position2: Position-2
color: Color

drawLink.title: drawLink
drawLink.docSyntax: map drawLink [from, to, param type, line_type, color, arrow_scale]
parameters: map: Control - The map.
from: Editor Object - Editor object from which the line is drawn.
to: Editor Object - Editor object to which the line is drawn.
param type: String - Identifier to be used in removeDrawLinks (for example, "NEXTTASK", "PARENT" or "TRIGGER").
line_type: String - "ARROW" or "LINE".
color: Color - Line color.
arrow_scale: Number - 0-1 (optional).

drawNavmesh.title: drawNavmesh
parameters: object: Object - The object whose navigation mesh should be drawn.
draw: Boolean - If true, draws the navigation mesh, false to stop drawing it.

drawOpticsOverlay.title: drawOpticsOverlay
parameters: set: Boolean - If true, then overlays are visible on the View Client.

drawPolygon.title: drawPolygon
parameters: map: Control - Map control to draw on.
positions: Array of Position3D - Coordinates that define the polygon path (must be 3-dimensional, even though the z-value is ignored).
color: Color - Line color.

drawRectangle.title: drawRectangle
drawRectangle.docSyntax: map drawRectangle [center, a, b, angle, color, fill]
parameters: map: Control
[center, a, b, angle, color, fill]: Array

drawStationary.title: drawStationary
parameters: unit: Object - The unit.
return_value: Array - [drawType, maxSize, growRate, [color, 3Doffset]] - For array values, see setDrawStationary.

driveOnRoadSide.title: driveOnRoadSide
parameters: roadside: String - Can be "middle", "left" or "right".

driver.title: driver
parameters: vehicle: Object - The vehicle.
return_value: Object - The unit sitting in the driver seat. If the vehicle is not a vehicle but a person, the person is returned.

driverOverride.title: driverOverride
return_value: Boolean - If true, then driver override is on, false otherwise.

drop.title: drop
parameters: array: Array - The particle, defined as ParticleArray.

echo.title: echo
parameters: text: String

editObject.title: editObject
parameters: map: Control - Editor map.
object: Editor Object - The object.

editorAddEventHandler.title: editorAddEventHandler
parameters: map: Control - Editor map.
event: String - Name of the event to respond to (see editorSetEventHandler).
function: String - Code to execute when the event happens. Can use the array _this, which contains EH-relevant information.
return_value: Number - ID of the handler (to use with editorRemoveEventHandler), or -1 when addition fails.

editorRemoveEventHandler.title: editorRemoveEventHandler
parameters: map: Control - Editor map.
event: String - Name of the event to respond to (see editorSetEventHandler).
id: Number - Event ID number returned by editorAddEventHandler.

editorSetEventHandler.title: editorSetEventHandler
parameters: map: Control - Editor map.
event: String - Name of the event to respond to (see Description above).
function: String - Code to execute when the event happens. Can use the array _this, which contains EH-relevant information.

effectiveCommander.title: effectiveCommander
parameters: vehicle: Object - The vehicle
return_value: Object - Unit who is the effective commander.

emptyPositions.title: emptyPositions
parameters: vehicle: Object - The vehicle.
position: String - Position type to look for. Can be "Commander", "Driver", "Gunner" or "Cargo".
return_value: Number - Number of empty positions available.

enable3DLinking.title: enable3DLinking
parameters: map: Control - The map
enable : Boolean - If true, 3D linking is enabled, false otherwise.

enableAI.title: enableAI
parameters: unit: Object - The unit.
skilltype: String - See disableAI or disableAI for possible values.

enableAIFeature.title: enableAIFeature
parameters: feature: String - The AI feature ("AwareFormationSoft" or "CombatFormationSoft").
enable: Boolean - If true, the AI feature is enabled, false otherwise.

enableAttack.title: enableAttack
parameters: group: Object or Group - Group leader of group.
enable: Boolean - If true, the group leader can issue attack commands, false otherwise.

enableCamShake.title: enableCamShake
parameters: enable: Boolean - If true, then shake effects are visible.

enableCaustics.title: enableCaustics
parameters: enabled: Boolean - If true, then caustics are visible (if respective video options are enabled).

enableCollisionVolumeDetection.title: enableCollisionVolumeDetection
parameters: object: Object - Unit or vehicle with attached collision volumes.
enable: Boolean - If true, the all collision volumes for object are enabled. If false, then all are disabled.

enableCommanding.title: enableCommanding
parameters: commanding: Boolean - If true, the player can give orders independently of their suspension status.

enableCustomSensor.title: enableCustomSensor
parameters: enable: Boolean - If true, then mode is enabled.
mode: String - Visualization mode.

enableEngineArtillery.title: enableEngineArtillery
parameters: enabled: Boolean - If true, artillery engine is enabled, false otherwise.

enableEnvironment.title: enableEnvironment
parameters: ambient: Boolean - If false, then ambient life and sounds are disabled.

enableExternalJoystick.title: enableExternalJoystick
parameters: enable: Boolean - If true, then external input is enabled, and internal input disabled.

enableForceSimul.title: enableForceSimul
parameters: force: Boolean - If true, then simulation keeps running even when window focus is lost (default: false, unless -forceSimul is used).

enableGPS.title: enableGPS
parameters: enable: Boolean - If true, then the GPS can be used on the map.

enableGunLights.title: enableGunLights
parameters: unit: Object or Group - Unit or group, forced to use gun lights.
value: Boolean - If true, then use lights. Setting it to false does not have any effect.

enableLightSystem.title: enableLightSystem
parameters: vehicle: Object - Vehicle with a LightSystems class defined.
system: String - Name (case-sensitive) of light system to control.
state: Number - Light state to activate (-2,-1,1, or 2). See description for details.
return_value: Boolean - If true, then light state is successfully changed. If false, then either the light system does not exist, or another state prevents the new state change (for example, convoy state is on, which prevents headlights from functioning).

enablePersonalItems.title: enablePersonalItems
parameters: unit: Object - The unit whose personal items are enabled.
enable: Boolean - If true, personal items are enabled, false otherwise.

enableRadio.title: enableRadio
parameters: state: Boolean - If true, enables the radio, false otherwise.

enableReload.title: enableReload
parameters: unit: Object - AI unit.
enable: Boolean - If true, the weapon is reloaded.

enableReloadWeak.title: enableReloadWeak
parameters: unit: Object - AI unit.
enable: Boolean - If true, the weapon is reloaded.

enableSaving.title: enableSaving
parameters: enable: Boolean - Controls manual and automatic saves (true, enabled; false, disabled).

enableSentences.title: enableSentences
parameters: enable: Boolean

enableSimulation.title: enableSimulation
parameters: object: Object - Object whose visual simulation is enabled / disabled.
enabled: Boolean - If true, simulation is enabled, false otherwise.

enableSmartOrder.title: enableSmartOrder
parameters: group: Group - Group to which the formation is applied.

enable: Boolean - If true, then group members might be re-ordered when assuming a new formation (each unit moves to the position in the new formation that is closest to them). If false, the groups are not re-ordered (default: true).

enableTeamSwitch.title: enableTeamSwitch
parameters: enable: Boolean - If true, Team Switch is available, false otherwise (default: true).

enableTrackIR.title: enableTrackIR
parameters: enable: Boolean - If true, the TrackIR is enabled.

enableTurretTrans.title: enableTurretTrans
parameters: vehicle: Object - The vehicle whose smooth turret transition is enabled / disabled.
turretPath: Array - The path to the turret.
enableTransition: Boolean - Enable / disable smooth turret transition (optional, default: true).

endMission.title: endMission
parameters: endType: String - See description for possible endings.

engineOn.title: engineOn
parameters: vehicle: Object - The vehicle.
state: Boolean - Set to true to turn the engine on, false to turn it off.

estimatedEndServerTime.title: estimatedEndServerTime
return_value: Number - Returns time (in seconds), defined as mission end.

estimatedTimeLeft.title: estimatedTimeLeft
parameters: seconds: Number - Number of seconds added to the current time.

evalObjectArgument.title: evalObjectArgument
parameters: map: Control - The map.
object: Editor Object - Editor Object on the map.
argument: String - Editor Object argument.

exec.title: exec
parameters: argument: Any Value - the argument which should be passed to the script. To pass multiple arguments, use an array.

script: String - the name of the script. It should be given relatively to the mission folder, campaign scripts subfolder or global scripts folder and is searched there in the same order. If you refer to a script packed together with an addon, the path should look like this: "\ADDON_PBO_NAME\script.sqs", where ADDON_PBO_NAME is the name of the addon *.pbo file without extension.

execEditorScript.title: execEditorScript
parameters: map: Control - The map.
object: Editor Object - Editor Object on the map.
script: String - Can be: "create", "update", "updatePosition", "select", "destroy".

execFSM.title: execFSM
parameters: argument: Anything - Available as _this in the called FSM.
filename: String - Name of FSM script to execute.

executeOnServer.title: executeOnServer
parameters: code: String - Code to execute on the server.
parameter: Anything - Any data type supported by publicVariable can be passed (optional).

executeWhereLocal.title: executeWhereLocal
parameters: object: Object or Group - Object or group to evaluate, to determine the local computer.
code: String - Code to be executed on the local machine. The passed parameter is available as _this. The evaluated object is available as _object or _group, based on whether object or group is used.
parameter: Anything - Any data type supported by publicVariable can be passed (optional).

execVM.title: execVM
parameters: argument: Anything - Argument that is passed to the called script, which can read using the _this variable. If multiple arguments are required, then an array can be passed, with its elements being available as _this select 0, _this select 1, and so on.
filename: String - Path to script file.
return_value: Script - Script handle, which can be used to determine (using scriptDone) when the called script finishes.

exitOnMapKey.title: exitOnMapKey
parameters: map: Control -
enable : Boolean -

exitWith.title: exitWith
parameters: condition: Boolean - If true, then the current scope exits.
code: Code - Code that is executed before the scope exits.

exp.title: exp
parameters: x: Number

expectedDestination.title: expectedDestination
parameters: unit: Object - AI unit with destination.
return_value: Array - [position, planningMode, forceReplan] (see setDestination for details).

exportASCIIGrid.title: exportASCIIGrid
parameters: filename: String - File name (including extension) to output to.
enable_rivers: Boolean - If true, rivers heightmap data is exported as well (optional, default: false) (V3.9.0+).
return_value: Boolean - Returns true, if the file is created.

exportCostMap.title: exportCostMap
parameters: file: String - File name of the exported image (bitmap format is always BMP, even if a different extension is specified). If no path is specified, the file is written to the root of the VBS installation folder.

exportEMF.title: exportEMF
parameters: filename: String - File name or absolute path to file (for example, "myFile.emf" or "c:\\myFile.emf"). If no path is specified, the file is saved in the VBS installation folder.
drawgrid: Boolean - Draw grid (optional, default: true).
drawcontours: Boolean - Draw contours (optional, default: true).
drawtypes: Number - Draw types (optional, default is 256, which represents all types):Roads: 1Buildings: 2Vegetation: 4Water: 8Trees: 16Fences: 32Walls: 64Powerlines: 128Undefined: 256
Roads: 1
Buildings: 2
Vegetation: 4
Water: 8
Trees: 16
Fences: 32
Walls: 64
Powerlines: 128
Undefined: 256
flipvertical: Boolean - Flips the EMF upside down (optional, default: false). By default EMF, assumes 0,0 as the top left - only available in V1.23+.

exportMap.title: exportMap
exportMap.docSyntax: exportMap [path, scale, x, y, w, h, detail, grid, relief, type, externalOverlay]
parameters: path: String - Output folder name (created, if it does not exist yet). Can either be an absolute or relative path (relative in relation to the VBS installation folder). The name of the created file consists of the map name, followed by creation time.
scale: Number - Map scale to use for output (for example, 2500 means 1:2500).
x: Number - Leftmost x-value of exported area (in-game coordinates) (optional, default: 0).
y: Number - Bottom y-value of exported area (in-game coordinates) (optional, default: 0).
w: Number - Width (in meters) of the area to export. If < 0, then everything to the right of 'x' is exported (optional, default: -1).
h: Number - Height (in meters) of the area to export. If < 0, then everything above 'y' is exported (optional, default: -1).
detail: Number - Level of detail to export (between .001 and 1, for maximum detail) (optional, default depends on the defined scale).
grid: String - Grid type to show. Can be "BNG" (V3.8.1+), "MGRS", "UTM", "LL" (Lat,Long), "LLMS" (Lat,Long in D°M'S), "current" (grid system on current game map) or "none".
relief: Boolean - If true, then the output shows relief features (indicating elevations) (optional, default: false).
type: String - Can be any of the following (optional, default: "PDF") (V17.2.0+):"MBTiles""PDF""PNG""SVG""TIFF"
"MBTiles"
"PDF"
"PNG"
"SVG"
"TIFF"
externalOverlay: Boolean - If true, then the output includes overlays generated by external components (optional, default: false) (V18.3.0+).
return_value: Boolean - If true, then the map is exported successfully.

exportMapSHP.title: exportMapSHP
exportMapSHP.docSyntax: exportMapSHP [path, contourHeight, colors, filter, x, y, w, h]
parameters: path: String - Folder name to output to (gets created, if it does not exist yet). Can be an absolute path (with drive letter), or, if relative, in VBS3 installation folder.
contourHeight: Number - Height step for contours (optional, default: 100).
colors: Number - Number of colors to use for relief shading (optional, default: 12).

filter: Number - Which objects to export. Multiple filters can be combined by adding their associated numbers (optional, default: 1048575 / all) 1: Water2: ContourLine4: ForestArea8: RockArea16: Track32: Road64: MainRoad128: Tree256: SmallTree512: Bush1024: Rock2048: Building4096: Wall8192: Fence16384: Powerline32768: AirportRunway65536: AirportTaxiway131072: AirportTaxiGuide262144: Location524288: ShadedRelief
1: Water
2: ContourLine

8: RockArea
16: Track
32: Road

2048: Building
4096: Wall
8192: Fence
16384: Powerline
32768: AirportRunway
65536: AirportTaxiway
131072: AirportTaxiGuide
262144: Location
524288: ShadedRelief
x: Number - Leftmost x-value of exported area (in game coordinates) (optional, default: 0).
y: Number - Bottom y-value of exported area (in game coordinates) (optional, default: 0).
w: Number - Width (in meters) of area to export. If < 0, then everything to the right of x is exported (optional, default: -1).
h: Number - Height (in meters) of area to export. If < 0, then everything above y is exported (optional, default: -1).
return_value: Boolean - If true, then map is exported.

exportSHP.title: exportSHP
parameters: filenameObjects: String - File name for objects lists.
filenameRoads: String - File name for roads lists (must be different from filenameObjects).

filter: Number - Object filter (V3.10+).Multiple filters can be combined by adding their associated numbers (optional, if omitted, then all objects are listed):1: Tree2: SmallTree4: Bush8: Building16: House2048: Rock1048576: Fence2097152: Wall16777216: Road33554432: Forest2147483648: Track4294967296: MainRoad8589934592: Rocks17179869184: PowerLines

ExternalSynchronization.title: ExternalSynchronization
parameters: time: Number - Synchronized time.
fpsLimit: Number - Maximum FPS.
noSleep: Boolean - No sleep in the main thread. If true, fpsLimit is used for particle simulation. If false, a constant simulation step is performed (optional, default: true) (V3.4+).

eyePos.title: eyePos

parameters: filter: String - File name, or full path to file to watch. Typical windows wildcards (* or ?) can be used on the file name (but not the path). If no path is specified, then the installation folder is used.

parameters: object: Object - Unit or, in V3.20+, any object.
bone: String - Name of bone to look for.
return_value: Number - ID of the specified bone. If the bone does not exist in model, -1 is returned.

findCover.title: findCover

parameters: object: Object - Unit for which to seek cover
currPosition: Position-2 - Center position around which to search
hidePosition: Position-2 - Position from which the unit should hide from
maxDist: Number - Maximum radius to search (optional)
minDist: Number - Minimum distance from initial position (optional)
visPosition: Position-2 - Position that unit should be able to see from the cover location (optional)
ignore: Object - Ignore this object during the cover search (optional)

value1: String - Qualifier value that should be matched (optional).

parameters: flag: Object - The flag.
return_value: Object - The person or vehicle that owns the flag is returned. If used on anything else than a flag, the returned value is objNull. If the flag is on its pole, the return value is NULL. If the flagowner is dead, the return value is the name of the soldier model.

parameters: unit: Object - Unit to check.

fogForecast2.title: fogForecast2
return_value: Array of Number - Returns [density, decay, altitude], as set by setFog.

for_forspec.title: for_forspec
parameters: start: Code - Executes once at the start of the loop. If an index variable is to be used in the loop or the loop specification, it has to be assigned here. Can be empty.
continue: Code - As long as this code (or variable) returns true, the loop continues. Once it returns false, the loop exits immediately (without executing the code section). Cannot be empty.
step: Code - Executes after each loop. Can be empty, but the loop is only executed once if it is, ignoring the result of the continue parameter.
code: Code - Executes once per loop (after the first-time execution of the start code, and before each time the step code runs). Can be empty.

for_var.title: for_var
for_var.docSyntax: for loopvar from start to end do {code}
parameters: loopvar: String - Name of index variable to modify within the loop (must start with underscore, be all lowercase, and be enclosed in double quotes).
start: Number - Initial value to start loop with.
end: Number - Highest value in loop. Once loopvar is equal or greater than this number, the loop is exited.
code: Code - Code block to execute each loop cycle.

turnout: String - Whether crew should turn out or in. Can be:"OUT": Turn out."IN": Turn in."DEFAULT": Resume default behavior.
"OUT": Turn out.
"IN": Turn in.
"DEFAULT": Resume default behavior.

forceCrewInOutDriver.title: forceCrewInOutDriver
parameters: vehicle: Object - Vehicle with a hatched driver position.
turnout: String - Whether driver should turn out or in. Can be:"OUT": Turn out."IN": Turn in."DEFAULT": Resume default behavior.
"OUT": Turn out.
"IN": Turn in.
"DEFAULT": Resume default behavior.

"DEFAULT": Resume default behavior.

1: Killed (no effect in MP)
2: Loser

var2: Any Value - Variable referenced by %2.
return_value: String - The full string (with replaced variables). In versions below V3.5, the maximum length for a string is 2048. In V3.5+, the limit is only restricted by the available memory, and is "unlimited" for all practical purposes.

fowGetKnownEntities.title: fowGetKnownEntities
parameters: mode: String - FOW mode. Can be:"ORBAT" (Default) - All entities in the line-of-sight of the player, regardless of side. And all entities within the player Higher echelon (V19.1.0+)."OFF": Shows nothing."ALL": Shows all units present."SIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s)."VISIBLE": Shows all units physically visible to specified observer ."VISIBLESIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s), and those physically visible to them (V19.1.0+)."NONE": Shows only the player. In V19.1.0+, also accounts for the new FOW system.
"ORBAT" (Default) - All entities in the line-of-sight of the player, regardless of side. And all entities within the player Higher echelon (V19.1.0+).
"OFF": Shows nothing.
"ALL": Shows all units present.
"SIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s).
"VISIBLE": Shows all units physically visible to specified observer .
"VISIBLESIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s), and those physically visible to them (V19.1.0+).
"NONE": Shows only the player. In V19.1.0+, also accounts for the new FOW system.
observer: Object - Observer entity.
return_value: Array - All known entities and their last positions in the format: [[entity1, position1], [entity2, position2], ...]

fowIsKnown.title: fowIsKnown
parameters: object: Object - Entity, whose presence and position are checked.

mode: String - FOW mode. Can be:"ORBAT" (Default) - All entities in the line-of-sight of the player, regardless of side. And all entities within the player Higher echelon (V19.1.0+)."OFF": Shows nothing."ALL": Shows all units present."SIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s)."VISIBLE": Shows all units physically visible to specified observer ."VISIBLESIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s), and those physically visible to them (V19.1.0+)."NONE": Shows only the player. In V19.1.0+, also accounts for the new FOW system.
"ORBAT" (Default) - All entities in the line-of-sight of the player, regardless of side. And all entities within the player Higher echelon (V19.1.0+).
"OFF": Shows nothing.
"ALL": Shows all units present.
"SIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s).
"VISIBLE": Shows all units physically visible to specified observer .
"VISIBLESIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s), and those physically visible to them (V19.1.0+).
"NONE": Shows only the player. In V19.1.0+, also accounts for the new FOW system.
observer: Object - Observer entity.
return_value: known: Boolean - Returns true, if the entity is known by the observer; false otherwise.
position: PositionASL - Last known entity position; or [0,0,0], if they are not known.

fowIsVisible.title: fowIsVisible
parameters: object: Object - Entity, whose visibility is checked.

mode: String - FOW mode. Can be:"ORBAT" (Default) - All entities in the line-of-sight of the player, regardless of side. And all entities within the player Higher echelon (V19.1.0+)."OFF": Shows nothing."ALL": Shows all units present."SIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s)."VISIBLE": Shows all units physically visible to specified observer ."VISIBLESIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s), and those physically visible to them (V19.1.0+)."NONE": Shows only the player. In V19.1.0+, also accounts for the new FOW system.
"ORBAT" (Default) - All entities in the line-of-sight of the player, regardless of side. And all entities within the player Higher echelon (V19.1.0+).
"OFF": Shows nothing.
"ALL": Shows all units present.
"SIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s).
"VISIBLE": Shows all units physically visible to specified observer .
"VISIBLESIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s), and those physically visible to them (V19.1.0+).
"NONE": Shows only the player. In V19.1.0+, also accounts for the new FOW system.
observer: Object - Observer entity.
return_value: Boolean - Returns true, if the specified entity is visible; false otherwise.

return_value: Anything - Value returned by either 'trueCode' or 'falseCode'.

list.title: list
parameters: trigger: Triggers - Trigger to activate.
return_value: Array or Nothing - It returns nothing before the simulation starts - in an (undelayed) init.sqf or in the VBS OME. Returns an Array references to the trigger list, after the simulation starts. Since this is just a reference, this means that the value in your local variable changes as the content of the trigger area changes. To permanently copy the returned list to a different variable, use _mylist = +(list triggerOne).

loadBiotope.title: loadBiotope
parameters: file : String - File name of biotope definition (SX file) to load.Biotope is not loaded, if file does not exist (V3.9.3+).Special keywords (since V3.9.3 to V17.4):"" - Temporarily clears the biotope. If done prior to mission save, the map default biotope is used on mission load."none" - Forces empty biotope."map" - Loads default map biotope.Special keywords (in V18.1+):"" - Forces empty biotope. If done prior to mission save, empty biotope remains on load (the same as the "none" keyword)."none" - Forces empty biotope."map" - Loads default map biotope."mission" - Loads biotope saved in current mission file.

loadBTSet.title: loadBTSet
parameters: filename: String - If no path (or a relative path, for example: scripts\doit.btset) is given, then the file is read from the installation folder (or from an addon). Absolute paths (for example, c:\bi\scripts\doit.btset) can be used as well.
return_value: 2 - Error loading .btset file (error when opening or reading from the file).
3 - Error loading a dependent file (any other file than the argument given to loadBTSet, for example: .bt or .lua files or previously loaded BT sets).
4 - Error in format (that is, the file opens, but contains errors).
10 - Invalid signature (one of the Behavior Trees in the .btset file contains an invalid signature file).

planDrawIcon.title: planDrawIcon
planDrawIcon.docSyntax: plan planDrawIcon [icon, color, position, width, height, angle]
parameters: plan: Control - PlanView control.

icon: String - Icon to display. Can either be a Procedural Textures or a path. If using a procedural color, then all channels should be set to 1 (...color(1,1,1,1)), so that the following 'color' argument will work correctly. If a path is specified, then it can either refer to an absolute path on a local drive (path must start with the drive letter), or to an addon path (no drive letter).
color: Color - Color applied to non-transparent parts of the icon.
position: Position-2 - Section-relative position where center of the icon will be placed.
width: Number - Horizontal "radius" of icon.
height: Number - Vertical "radius" of icon.
angle: Number - Rotation angle (in degrees).

If no setSeaState is set, or if it is set to -1, then -1 is returned.

parameters: unit: Object - Unit, whose weapon is set.

muzzle: String - Class name of the muzzle to set (optional, default: all muzzles) (V3.6+).
magazine: String - Class name of the magazine to set (only affects the current magazine - or the next one, if the current one is empty).

mode: String - Fuse mode. Can be:"initSpeed": Set the speed of the next round (applies to only one round) (V3.8.2+)."distance": Detonate after traversed distance, defined in setting ."timed": Detonate after time elapsed, defined in setting ."default": Use weapon defaults.
"initSpeed": Set the speed of the next round (applies to only one round) (V3.8.2+).
"distance": Detonate after traversed distance, defined in setting .
"timed": Detonate after time elapsed, defined in setting .
"default": Use weapon defaults.
setting: Number - Fuse property. Either meters or seconds, depending on the selected mode.

setBalancingOffload.title: setBalancingOffload
parameters: limit: Number - Ratio of the average workload (calculated from the server and all connected SCs) that is handled by the server itself (default: 0 = 0%)

setBalancingThreshold.title: setBalancingThreshold
parameters: limit: Number - Factor by which an SC entity count has to exceed the average, before being balanced (average is calculated from all the connected SCs). A value of 1 means no threshold at all (workload is distributed equally among all SCs), and a value of 2 means there have to be twice as many entities on an SC before they get redistributed (default: 1.1).

value: Number, String, Boolean or Array - New attribute value (the type of value passed depends on what the attribute used originally). Some attributes have maximum values defined. If the defined value exceeds this limit, then the limit value is used instead.

"Turret"
"Cargo"
"Commander" (refers to the commander seat, not the commanding unit).

blocked: Boolean - If true, then the seat gets blocked; if false, it gets unblocked (optional, default: true).

setCamSensorOverride.title: setCamSensorOverride

mode: String - Mode to use. Can be:"THERMAL" : Forces thermal vision."NIGHTVISION" : Forces night vision."NVGTI" : Forces combined night vision / thermal mode (V3.20+)."VISIBLE" : Forces regular view, even if the player is currently using a sensor device (for example, NV goggles). Any masks (for example, the circular blackout for NV) stay visible."" (empty string): Turns the override off, and should always be used together with override set to false.
"THERMAL" : Forces thermal vision.
"NIGHTVISION" : Forces night vision.
"NVGTI" : Forces combined night vision / thermal mode (V3.20+).
"VISIBLE" : Forces regular view, even if the player is currently using a sensor device (for example, NV goggles). Any masks (for example, the circular blackout for NV) stay visible.
"" (empty string): Turns the override off, and should always be used together with override set to false.

vertCoef: Number - Strength of vertical camera pan (up / down), practical range: 0-10.
horzCoef: Number - Strength of horizontal camera pan (left / right), practical range: 0-10.
bankCoef: Number - Strength of camera tilt / bank, practical range: 0-20.
interpolation: Boolean - If true, then transitions in the different shaking directions are smoother.

setCausticsParams.title: setCausticsParams
setCausticsParams.docSyntax: setCausticsParams [maxdist, maxdepth, sizeUp, sizeDn, interval, depthFade, granularity, brightness]
parameters: maxdist: Number - Maximum distance (in meters) at which caustics are visible (default: 200).
maxdepth: Number - Maximum depth (in meters) at which caustics are rendered (default: 100).
sizeUp: Number - Length of a caustics rendering square (at zero depth) (default: 4).
sizeDn: Number - Length of a caustics rendering square (at maximum rendering depth) (default: 130).
interval: Number - Frequency (in seconds) of texture changes (default: 0.08).
depthFade: Number - How fast the intensity fades with depth (as coefficient: 1.0 = linear, 2.0 = quadratic, and so on) (default: 2).
granularity: Number - Distance (in meters) over which two caustic textures are interpolated (at different depths) (default: 2).
brightness: Number - Brightness coefficient (default: 4).
