setDefaultFogOfWar.title: setDefaultFogOfWar
parameters: mode: String - FOW mode. Can be:"ORBAT" (Default) - All entities in the line-of-sight of the player, regardless of side. And all entities within the player Higher echelon (V19.1.0+)."OFF": Shows nothing."ALL": Shows all units present."SIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s)."VISIBLE": Shows all units physically visible to specified observer ."VISIBLESIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s), and those physically visible to them (V19.1.0+)."NONE": Shows only the player. In V19.1.0+, also accounts for the new FOW system.
"ORBAT" (Default) - All entities in the line-of-sight of the player, regardless of side. And all entities within the player Higher echelon (V19.1.0+).
"OFF": Shows nothing.
"ALL": Shows all units present.
"SIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s).
"VISIBLE": Shows all units physically visible to specified observer .
"VISIBLESIDE": Show all units of the specified observer side(s), and those physically visible to them (V19.1.0+).
"NONE": Shows only the player. In V19.1.0+, also accounts for the new FOW system.
observer: Object - Observer entity.

setDefaultScope.title: setDefaultScope
parameters: map: Control - Map control.
objects: Array - Array of either Editor Objects (for example, [_unit_0]) or actual Game Objects (for example, [player]). If the array is empty, then the command is applied to all Editor Objects.

scope: String - Can be:"All": You can do anything with the given Editor Objects."AllNoCopy": You cannot copy the given Editor Objects."AllNoDrag": You cannot drag the given Editor Objects."AllNoTree": The given Editor Objects are not visible in the Scenario Objects Tree."AllNoCopyNoTree": You cannot copy the given Editor Objects, and they do not appear in the Scenario Objects Tree (V1.22+)."AllNoCopyNoTreeNoEdit": You cannot copy or edit the given Editor Objects, and they do not appear in the Scenario Objects Tree (V1.22+)."Hide": The given Editor Objects are not visible (and by that, you are not able to change them in any way)."LinkTo": You can only link to the given Editor Objects."LinkFrom": You can only link from the given Editor Objects."Select": You can only select the given Editor Objects."View": The given Editor Objects are only visible, but no changes are possible.
"All": You can do anything with the given Editor Objects.
"AllNoCopy": You cannot copy the given Editor Objects.
"AllNoDrag": You cannot drag the given Editor Objects.
"AllNoTree": The given Editor Objects are not visible in the Scenario Objects Tree.
"AllNoCopyNoTree": You cannot copy the given Editor Objects, and they do not appear in the Scenario Objects Tree (V1.22+).
"AllNoCopyNoTreeNoEdit": You cannot copy or edit the given Editor Objects, and they do not appear in the Scenario Objects Tree (V1.22+).
"Hide": The given Editor Objects are not visible (and by that, you are not able to change them in any way).
"LinkTo": You can only link to the given Editor Objects.
"LinkFrom": You can only link from the given Editor Objects.
"Select": You can only select the given Editor Objects.
"View": The given Editor Objects are only visible, but no changes are possible.
subordinates: Boolean - If true, then subordinates in the editor are assigned the same scope as the parent.

setDrawIcon.title: setDrawIcon
setDrawIcon.docSyntax: map setDrawIcon [object, icon, color, offset, width, height, autoscale, angle, identifier, shadow, text, is3D, drawline, priority]
parameters: map: Control - Map control to draw on (only works with editor map).
object: Editor Object - Editor Object the icon is attached to.

icon: String - Icon to display. Can either be a Procedural Textures or a path. If using a procedural color, then all channels should be set to 1 (color(1,1,1,1)), so that the following color parameter works correctly. If a path is specified, then it can either refer to an absolute path on a local drive (path must start with the drive letter), or to an addon path (no drive letter).

color: Color - Color applied to non-transparent parts of the icon, as well as the text label. For 3D icons, the specified color is only used when the object is not selected. Otherwise, it is yellow, when the cursor is over the object, and green when it is selected.
offset: Array - Offset from object (in meters) for [x,y,z]. The z-value only has an effect for 3D icons.
width: Number - Horizontal icon "radius".
height: Number - Vertical icon "radius" of icon.

autoscale: Boolean or Number - If true, the icon scales with the map when zooming in / out, to keep its size relative to the screen. If false, then the icon absolute size always be the same, relative to the screen. If a Number, the icon maintains its size, if the map scale is less than that number (3D icons are always auto-scaled).
angle: Number - Non-functional.
identifier: String - Icon identifier. Can be used with removeDrawIcon. Must be unique to create a new icon (otherwise, the existing icon is modified with the new settings).
shadow: Boolean - If true, then black parts of the icon are drawn in a darker shade.
text: String - Text which appears next to the icon. Text size is always the same, even when autoscale is on.
is3D: Boolean - If true, then the icon is only visible on the 3D editor map, if false then it is only visible in 2D (optional, default: false).
drawline: Boolean - Used only with 3D icons. If true, then a line is drawn from the icon closest to the camera, to the assigned object (optional if is3D is not defined, mandatory if it is).

priority: Number - If the icons overlap, then the one with the lower priority value is drawn on top. If priority values are the same, then the draw order is undefined (unpredictable) (optional, default: 0).

4: Switches 3D drawing to a cloud (instead of disc, 2 must be set to be visible).

growRate: Number - Growth rate of the mark in meters per second (optional, default: 0.03).
color: Color - 2D and 3D marker color (optional, default: [0,0,1,.7]). Alpha value is optional. If color array is empty, the default color set by VBS2.cfg is used (V1.31+).
offset: Number - Offsets the default 3D disc representation above ground by the given value in meters (optional, default: 0.1).

"All": You can do anything with the given Editor Objects.
"AllNoCopy": You cannot copy the given Editor Objects.

"AllNoTree": The given Editor Objects are not visible in the Scenario Objects Tree (upper-right tab in OME / RTE).

"Hide": The given Editor Objects are not visible at all (you are not able to change them in any way).
"LinkTo": You can only link to the given Editor Objects.
"LinkFrom": You can only link from the given Editor Objects.
"Select": You can only select the given Editor Objects.
"View": The given Editor Objects are only visible, no changes possible.

setEditorTypeScope.title: setEditorTypeScope
parameters: map: Control - Map control.
objectType: String - Editor Object type.

scope: String - Can be:"All": You can do anything with the given Editor Objects."AllNoCopy": You cannot copy the given Editor Objects."AllNoDrag": You cannot drag the given Editor Objects."AllNoTree": The given Editor Objects are not visible in the Scenario Objects Tree."AllNoCopyNoTree": You cannot copy the given Editor Objects, and they do not appear in the Scenario Objects Tree (V1.22+)."AllNoCopyNoTreeNoEdit": You cannot copy or edit the given Editor Objects, and they do not appear in the Scenario Objects Tree (V1.22+)."Hide": The given Editor Objects are invisible (you cannot change them in any way)."LinkTo": You can only link to the given Editor Objects."LinkFrom": You can only link from the given Editor Objects."Select": You can only select the given Editor Objects."View": Only the given Editor Objects are visible, no changes are possible.
"All": You can do anything with the given Editor Objects.
"AllNoCopy": You cannot copy the given Editor Objects.
"AllNoDrag": You cannot drag the given Editor Objects.
"AllNoTree": The given Editor Objects are not visible in the Scenario Objects Tree.
"AllNoCopyNoTree": You cannot copy the given Editor Objects, and they do not appear in the Scenario Objects Tree (V1.22+).
"AllNoCopyNoTreeNoEdit": You cannot copy or edit the given Editor Objects, and they do not appear in the Scenario Objects Tree (V1.22+).
"Hide": The given Editor Objects are invisible (you cannot change them in any way).
"LinkTo": You can only link to the given Editor Objects.
"LinkFrom": You can only link from the given Editor Objects.
"Select": You can only select the given Editor Objects.
"View": Only the given Editor Objects are visible, no changes are possible.

setFatigueMultiplier.title: setFatigueMultiplier
parameters: unit: Object - Affected unit.

multipliers: Array - Multiplication factors that are applied at different damage levels. Examples:[] - Resets the multipliers to their defaults ([1,1.33,2,3]).[1] - Applies the same factor to all damage levels (no handicap).[1,5] - Two stages: for up to 50% (no handicap), and over 50% (fatigue increases five times as fast).[1,1,2,10] - Four stages: for 25%, 50%, 75%, and 100%, up to 50% damage no handicaps are applied, between 50% and 75% the unit gets tired twice as fast and hears half as well, and from 75% damage gets tired ten times faster.
[] - Resets the multipliers to their defaults ([1,1.33,2,3]).
[1] - Applies the same factor to all damage levels (no handicap).
[1,5] - Two stages: for up to 50% (no handicap), and over 50% (fatigue increases five times as fast).

[1,1,2,10] - Four stages: for 25%, 50%, 75%, and 100%, up to 50% damage no handicaps are applied, between 50% and 75% the unit gets tired twice as fast and hears half as well, and from 75% damage gets tired ten times faster.

setFatigueRecoveryRate.title: setFatigueRecoveryRate

recovery: Number - Factor to apply to standard fatigue recovery rate. For example, a factor of 0.5 causes the recovery to takes twice as long, and a factor of 2 makes it last half as long (default: 1).

setFogOfWar.title: setFogOfWar
parameters: map: Control - Map control.

mode: String - Fog of War (FOW) mode. Can be:"ORBAT" (Default) - All entities in the line-of-sight of the player, regardless of side. And all entities within the player Higher echelon (V19.1.0+)."OFF": Shows nothing."ALL": Shows all units present."SIDE": Show all units of the specified perspective side(s)."VISIBLE": Shows all units physically visible to specified perspective ."VISIBLESIDE": Show all units of the specified perspective side(s), and those physically visible to them (V19.1.0+)."NONE": Shows only the player. In V19.1.0+, also accounts for the new Fog of War (FOW) system.
"ORBAT" (Default) - All entities in the line-of-sight of the player, regardless of side. And all entities within the player Higher echelon (V19.1.0+).
"OFF": Shows nothing.
"ALL": Shows all units present.
"SIDE": Show all units of the specified perspective side(s).
"VISIBLE": Shows all units physically visible to specified perspective .
"VISIBLESIDE": Show all units of the specified perspective side(s), and those physically visible to them (V19.1.0+).
"NONE": Shows only the player. In V19.1.0+, also accounts for the new Fog of War (FOW) system.
perspective: Array - If defined, FOW is applied from this perspective, instead of that of the player (optional).

setMapPrerender.title: setMapPrerender
parameters: mapDrawThreshold: Number - If drawing the map takes more than this amount (in milliseconds), the engine stops re-rendering the map each frame and reuses the already rendered map instead (default: 10).
mapScaleDelay: Number - Once the drawing time exceeds mapDrawThreshold, and you zoom in or out or move around the map, the map is redrawn only once every mapScaleDelay milliseconds (default: 250).

txtCheckInterval: Number - Applies only when map drawing time exceeds mapDrawThreshold and controls how often (in milliseconds) the engine rechecks the text labels on the map to see if it should be redrawn (optional, default: 1000).
return_value: Boolean - If true, then the command executes successfully.

parameters: aircraft: Object - AI-controlled plane or helicopter (usage with other types of vehicles may crash VBS).
angle: Number - Maximum bank angle (in degrees). Should be between 0 - 90.

setMaxDive.title: setMaxDive
parameters: aircraft: Object - AI-controlled plane or helicopter (usage with other types of vehicles may crash VBS).

vspeed: Number - Maximum vertical speed (in m/sec). Any positive value affects climb and dive speeds. Any negative value re-enables the defaults. The actual vertical speed may differ from the defined value by up to 5 m/sec.

setMaxEvaporation.title: setMaxEvaporation
parameters: evaporation: Number - Defines how fast the soil loses water from evaporation [mm/h] (default: 2).

setMaxFordingDepth.title: setMaxFordingDepth
parameters: vehicle: Object - Affected vehicle.
depth: Number - Fording depth to set. Setting the maximum fording depth to -1 causes the engine to revert to the default configuration value.

setMaxRainDensity.title: setMaxRainDensity
parameters: density: Number - How fast the soil gains water from rain [mm/h].

setMaxSpeedLimit.title: setMaxSpeedLimit
parameters: vehicle: Object - Vehicle to which the speed limit is applied to.
limit: Number - Approximate maximum limit in km/h. If set to <=0, the original limit from the vehicle configuration is used.

setMimic.title: setMimic
parameters: person: Object - Affected person.
mimic: String - Mimic type (see command description).

setMinAnimationSpeed.title: setMinAnimationSpeed
parameters: unit: Object - Affected unit.
percent: Number - In the range of 0 - 1. Controls the minimum analog input that is accepted for movement.

setMissionVersion.title: setMissionVersion
parameters: version: Number - Mission version.

setMotionController.title: setMotionController
parameters: object: Object - HLA gateway object.

setMousePosition.title: setMousePosition
parameters: [x, y]: Array - Values for x and y can be in the range from 0 - 1 for a 4:3 resolution, or the respective SafeZones, which can be used in any resolution.

setMsgPriority.title: setMsgPriority
parameters: unit: Object - Affecting Unit.
priority: Boolean - Whether or not to use priority messages.

setMusicEffect.title: setMusicEffect
parameters: trigger: Object - Trigger to associate with the music effect.
track: String - Music effect to play.

setName.title: setName
parameters: location: Location - Affected location.
name: String - Location name to set.

setNavigationSkill.title: setNavigationSkill
parameters: unit: Object - Unit to define navigation skill for.
skill: Number - Navigation skill, between 0 (lowest) - 1 (highest).

setNavmeshBlockers.title: setNavmeshBlockers
parameters: object: Object - Object, whose navigation mesh you want to update.
obstacles: Array - The array of obstacles , whose geometries you want to add to the navigation mesh. If empty, the original navigation mesh is restored.

setNavMeshParams.title: setNavMeshParams
parameters: param: String - Can be one of the following:roadAreaType: Determines the custom area type that roads are marked with on navigation mesh update (optional).Note: For roadAreaType to be functional, roads have to be loaded with loadAIRoads.crosswalkAreaType: Determines custom flags that crosswalks are marked with on navigation mesh update (optional).
roadAreaType: Determines the custom area type that roads are marked with on navigation mesh update (optional).Note: For roadAreaType to be functional, roads have to be loaded with loadAIRoads.
crosswalkAreaType: Determines custom flags that crosswalks are marked with on navigation mesh update (optional).

value: Array of Number or Number - Flag array or single flag value. There are two flags, so the array combinations are: [] (equivalent to specifying 0), [1], [2], [1, 2] (equivalent to specifying 3) (optional, default: 0).

setNetworkShell.title: setNetworkShell
parameters: vehicle: Object - Affected vehicle.
broadcast: Boolean - If true, the vehicle object is broadcast to other computers.

setNewConvoy.title: setNewConvoy
parameters: group: Group - Vehicle group
mode: Boolean - If true, then the new mode will be active. If false, then the old convoy behavior will be used (default).

setNightEffects.title: setNightEffects
parameters: on: Boolean - true - on, false - off.

setNVGContrast.title: setNVGContrast
parameters: contrast: Number - Contrast, between 0 - 1.

setNVGMode.title: setNVGMode
parameters: mode: Number - Can be:0 - Green (default).1 - White phosphorus.
0 - Green (default).
1 - White phosphorus.

setNVGTIContrast.title: setNVGTIContrast
parameters: contrast: Number - Contrast, between 0 - 1.

setNVGTIMode.title: setNVGTIMode
parameters: mode: Number - Can be:0 - Green (default).1 - White phosphorus.
0 - Green (default).
1 - White phosphorus.

setObjectArguments.title: setObjectArguments
parameters: map: Control - Map control.
object: Editor Object - Affected Editor Object.
assignments: Array - Each element is [name, value], where name is String and value is Anything.

setObjectProxy.title: setObjectProxy
parameters: map: Control - Map control.
object: Editor Object - Affected Editor Object.
proxy: Object - Proxy object to set.

setObjectSimulation.title: setObjectSimulation
parameters: obj: Object - The object.

mode: String - Can be: "Interop" - External simulation using Interop interface. "Simulation" - Based on setSimulationMode. "External" - Based on setExternalControl. "Remote" - Based on setRemoteControl.
"Interop" - External simulation using Interop interface.
"Simulation" - Based on setSimulationMode.
"External" - Based on setExternalControl.
"Remote" - Based on setRemoteControl.
parameter: Number - The simulation mode number.

setObjectTexture.title: setObjectTexture
parameters: object: Object - Object that has hiddenSelections defined.
selection: String or Number - Name or index of the selection to texture.
texture: String - Path to image, procedural textures (see Ambient Shading and HDR Textures in the VBS3 Developer Reference), or video.

setObjectTextureGlobal.title: setObjectTextureGlobal
parameters: object: Object - Affected object.
selection: String or Number - Name or index of selection to texture.
texture: String - Path to texture bitmap or procedural textures (see Ambient Shading and HDR Textures in the VBS3 Developer Reference).

setOpticsAutoBC.title: setOpticsAutoBC
parameters: enable: Boolean - If true, sets an automatic brightness and contrast; false, otherwise.

setOpticsBlurCoef.title: setOpticsBlurCoef
parameters: blurLevel: Number -

setOpticsBrightness.title: setOpticsBrightness
parameters: brightness: Number - Optics brightness level.

setOpticsBrightnessMax.title: setOpticsBrightnessMax
parameters: brightness: Number - Maximum brightness level.

setOpticsBrightnessMin.title: setOpticsBrightnessMin
parameters: brightness: Number - Minimum brightness level.

setOpticsBrightnessOffset.title: setOpticsBrightnessOffset
parameters: offset: Number - Brightness correction value.

setOpticsDirection.title: setOpticsDirection
parameters: vehicle: Object - Vehicle with turret.
turret: Array - Turret to move.
azimuth: Number - Turret azimuth (in degrees).
elevation: Number - Turret elevation (in degrees).
range: Number - Distance to use for range offset calculation (overrides setLaserRange) (optional).

source: Array - Optics alignment of this source turret (using the specified direction and range) is applied to the turret specified in the first argument (used to align two different turrets on same vehicle) (optional).

setOpticsDOF.title: setOpticsDOF
parameters: focus: Number - Can be:-1: No override (default).0: Override, use auto focus.>0: Distance of the focal plane, in meters.
-1: No override (default).
0: Override, use auto focus.
>0: Distance of the focal plane, in meters.
blur: Number - Blur factor. Can be:0: No blur.1: Default blur.
0: No blur.
1: Default blur.

setOpticsMaxGainAmplifier.title: setOpticsMaxGainAmplifier
parameters: amplification: Number - Factor by which the light is amplified.

setOpticsOffset.title: setOpticsOffset
parameters: vehicle: Object - Affected vehicle.
gunner: Object - Vehicle gunner unit.
azimuth: Number - Offset azimuth.
elevation: Number - Offset elevation.Note: Lasing changes the elevation offset.
transition: Boolean - If true, an offset transition animation occurs; if false, the transition is immediate (optional, default: true).

setOpticsState.title: setOpticsState
setOpticsState.docSyntax: setOpticsState [active, zoom, visionmode, timode , weapon, transition, device, mode]
parameters: active: Boolean - Set to true to select optics.
zoom: Number or Array - Array is of the format of [zoom, continuous] (optional).Note: The zoom parameter has no effect in V1.50.
visionmode: Number - 0: day, 1: night, 2: thermal vision (optional for dismounted units).
timode: Number - Index of TI mode (optional for dismounted units).
weapon: String - Currently selected unit or turret weapon (optional).
transition: Number - Overrides the weapon bore sight to optics transition (blending) value (optional).
device: Number - Index of optic device on muzzle (optional) (V1.62+).
mode: Number - Index of optic mode of the optic device (optional) (V1.62+).

setOrigin.title: setOrigin
parameters: easting: Number - Easting (in meters).
northing: Number - Northing (in meters).
zone: Number - Zone number.
hemisphere: String - Hemisphere. Can be:"N": Northern hemisphere."S": Southern hemisphere.
"N": Northern hemisphere.
"S": Southern hemisphere.

setOvercast.title: setOvercast
parameters: time: Number - Overcast transition time (in seconds). A value of 0 means immediate change.

overcast: Number - Overcast in the range of 0 - 1. An overcast setting of 0 means clear (sunny) weather, and 1 means thunderstorms, fog, and rain are very likely. Higher overcast values also result in higher wind speeds.

setOwner.title: setOwner
parameters: shot: Object - Bullet, grenade, IED, or other explosion that can injure units.
owner: Object - Unit to associate with the shot.

setParticleCircle.title: setParticleCircle
parameters: particleSource: Object - Affected particle.
radius: Number - Radius (around the position specified in setParticleParams), within which new particles are created.
velocity: Vector3D - Direction vector that is added to the original velocity array, defined in setParticleParams.

setParticleLongRange.title: setParticleLongRange
parameters: particleSource: Object -Affected particle.
enabled: Boolean - If true, then particles are emitted even at long range.

setParticleParams.title: setParticleParams
parameters: particleSource: Object - Affected particle.
array: Array - Particle parameters, as specified in ParticleArray.

setParticleRandom.title: setParticleRandom
setParticleRandom.docSyntax: particleSource setParticleRandom [lifeTime, position, moveVelocity, rotationVelocity, size, color, randomDirectionPeriod, randomDirectionIntensity, {angle}]
parameters: particleSource: Object - Affected particle.
lifeTime: Number - Particle lifetime.
position: Position - Data Type: Particle 3D position.
moveVelocity: Number - Particle movement velocity (in m/s).
rotationVelocity: Number - Particle rotation velocity (in rad/s).
size: Number - Particle size.
color: Color - Particle color.
randomDirectionPeriod: Number - Period of time in which the particle moves in a random direction.
randomDirectionIntensity: Number - Particle random movement intensity.
angle: Number - Particle movement angle (in degrees).

setParticleSourceParams.title: setParticleSourceParams
parameters: particleSource: Object
forceGround: Boolean - If true, it will cause particles created by this source to be ground clamped. NOTE: this requires there to be a radius set (greater than 0) via setParticleCircle.
applySourceVelocity: Boolean - If true, the particles created by this source will have the parent object's current velocity added to the particle's initial velocity.
transformDirection: Boolean - If true, the particles created by this source will have their velocity transformed to be local to the source object.

setPathPlannerPlugin.title: setPathPlannerPlugin
parameters: unit: Object - AI unit to define path-planning for.

plugin: String - Name of the encrypted Fusion DLL, which is used for path-planning and navigation mesh generation. If only "PathPlanning" is defined, but no mesh name is specified, then the AI unit uses navigation meshes in buildings and ships, and the default VBS path-planning for outside areas.
mesh: String - Name of the navigation mesh to use exclusively (optional).

setPathPostprocessMode.title: setPathPostprocessMode
parameters: group: Group - AI group.

mode: String - Mode that defines which group members should post-process their path. Can be:"ONLYLEADER" - Only group leader (default)."ALL" - All the units in a group."NONE" - No unit in a group (V1.40+).
"ONLYLEADER" - Only group leader (default).
"ALL" - All the units in a group.
"NONE" - No unit in a group (V1.40+).

setPlayable.title: setPlayable
parameters: unit: Object - Affected AI unit.

setPlayerRespawnTime.title: setPlayerRespawnTime
parameters: interval: Number - respawn time in seconds

setPos.title: setPos
parameters: object: Object - Affected object.
pos: Position-2 - Object position.

setPosASL.title: setPosASL
parameters: object: Object - Affected object.
pos: PositionASL - ASL position.

setPosASL2.title: setPosASL2
parameters: object: Object - Affected object.
pos: PositionASL - ASL2 position.

setPosATL.title: setPosATL
parameters: object: Object - Affected object.
pos: PositionATL - ATL position.

setPosition.title: setPosition
parameters: location: Location - Location.
pos: Position - Data Type - Position to set.

setPrecipitation.title: setPrecipitation
parameters: type: String - Precipitation type. The supported values are:"snow""hail""sleet""rain"
"snow"
"hail"
"sleet"
"rain"
density: Number - Visibility of precipitation (0 - 1). Setting to 0 means no precipitation of that type.
severity: Number - Speed of precipitation (0 - 1).
ceiling: Number - Maximum altitude (in meters) of precipitation above sea level.

setPRF.title: setPRF
parameters: unit: Object - Unit with laser designator.
code: Number - PRF code that should be assigned to the laser designator of the unit.
muzzle: String - Muzzle name of laser designator.
return_value: Boolean - If PRF code is valid and assigned, true is returned; if the code is invalid, or the muzzle is not a laser designator, false is returned.

setRadioMsg.title: setRadioMsg
parameters: index: Number - Index of radio call (Alpha: 1, Beta: 2, and so on).
text: String - Message to show for radio call (set to "NULL" to disable radio call).

setRain.title: setRain
parameters: time: Number - Rain density transition time (in seconds). A transition time of 0 means an immediate change.
rain: Number - Rain density in the range of 0 - 1. A rain density of 0 is no rain (setting rain to 0 does not prevent thunderstorms, if a high overcast is set), and 1 is maximum rain.

setRandomWeather.title: setRandomWeather
parameters: mode: Boolean - If true, random weather is created; if false, no random weather is created.

setRank.title: setRank
parameters: unit: Object - Affected unit.
rank: String - Rank name that is defined in the relevant CfgRank class, in the commandString parameter (see Custom Rank System in the VBS3 Developer Reference).

setRectangular.title: setRectangular
parameters: location: Location - Affected location.
set: Boolean - If true, sets a rectangular shape for the location; if false (default), sets an elliptical shape for the location.

setReferenceMark.title: setReferenceMark
parameters: unit : Object - Unit or vehicle (empty or occupied) to assign mark to.
mark: Array - Reference mark (which was created, using createReferenceMark) to assign.
return_value: Boolean - If true, then the reference mark is successfully assigned. If the assignment is not possible (for example, because the unit / vehicle does not exist, or does not match the side of the reference mark), then false is returned.

setReferenceMarkColor.title: setReferenceMarkColor
parameters: mark: Array - Reference mark to color.
color: Color - New color (default: white).

setReferenceMarkPicture.title: setReferenceMarkPicture
parameters: mark: Array - Reference mark to apply the bitmap to.
bitmap: String - Path to bitmap. If only an image name is specified, then the VBS installation root folder is used.

setReferenceMarkPosASL.title: setReferenceMarkPosASL
parameters: mark: Array - Reference mark (created using createReferenceMark) to the given position.
position: PositionASL - New reference mark position.

setRegisteredParam.title: setRegisteredParam
parameters: type: String - Class whose configuration should be changed.
config: String - Name of configuration parameter to change (case-sensitive).
value: String, Number or Boolean - New value to be applied.

setRemoteControl.title: setRemoteControl
parameters: object: Object - Unit or vehicle.
controlled: Boolean - If true, then the object is remotely controlled.

setRenderMasked.title: setRenderMasked
parameters: type: String - General type of objects that should be masked. Name is case-sensitive, and can be:"ground" - Solid ground, including grass (but no bushes or rocks)."sky" - Sky, including clouds."water" - Open sea, lakes and rivers."staticobj" - Any objects placed on the map: Buildings, vehicles, people, trees, rocks, and so on.
"ground" - Solid ground, including grass (but no bushes or rocks).
"sky" - Sky, including clouds.
"water" - Open sea, lakes and rivers.
"staticobj" - Any objects placed on the map: Buildings, vehicles, people, trees, rocks, and so on.
masked: Boolean - If true, the mask is applied.

setRenderMasking.title: setRenderMasking
parameters: mask: Boolean - If true, then masking effects are applied to the objects specified in setRenderMasked. If false, then any existing effects are turned off.
alpha: Number - A reduction factor applied to alpha effects (for example, smoke). Range is from 0 to 1, with a value of 0 making the smoke the most visible and largest, and 1 making it invisible.
color: Color - Color that is applied to the mask.

setRepairCargo.title: setRepairCargo
parameters: vehicle: Object - Repair vehicle (transportRepair > 0).
factor: Number - Factor applied to vehicle transportRepair setting (if <1, limit is decreased, if >1 it is increased, if 0 then no repairs can be performed at all).

setRepairParts.title: setRepairParts
parameters: vehicle: Object - Repair truck.
parts: Number - Repair parts that should be available. If set to 0, then no further repairs are possible.

setRoadDrawDistance.title: setRoadDrawDistance
parameters: distance: Number - Maximum distance (in meters) at which roads are visible. A negative value changes the draw distance to the default specified in the map roadDrawDistance parameter (see VBS3.cfg Options in the VBS3 Administrator Manual), or, if undefined, to 3,000m.

setRotorWash.title: setRotorWash
parameters: strength: Number - Force of rotor wash.
diameter: Number - Maximum range.

setRtdFixedTimeStep.title: setRtdFixedTimeStep
parameters: step: Number - Synchronization frequency (in seconds) (default: 0.033).

setScale.title: setScale
parameters: object: Object - Object to scale.
scale: Array - Object size is multiplied by these numbers in each direction: [width, height, length]. Be aware that in V2.0-2.11, the array order is interpreted as: [width, length, height].

setScannerPRF.title: setScannerPRF
parameters: object: Object - Unit / vehicle with a laser scanner.
code: Number - PRF code that the scanner should look for (default: 1111).
return_value: Boolean - If the PRF code cab be assigned, true is returned; if the code is invalid, or the vehicle does not have a laser scanner, false is returned.

setSeaState.title: setSeaState
parameters: time: Number - Length of transition (in seconds).
state: Number - Wave height (in meters).

setSensitivity.title: setSensitivity
parameters: unit: Unit - AI unit.
type: String - Sensitivity to manipulate.
value: Number - 0: sense disabled, maximum: see type description.

setSensorNoise.title: setSensorNoise
setSensorNoise.docSyntax: setSensorNoise [sensorType, forced, intensity, sharpness, grainSize, intensityX0, intensityX1, monochrome]
parameters: sensorType: String - Either "NVG", "TI", or "NVGTI".
forced: Boolean - If true, the command overrides the current optics settings.
intensity: Number - Noise intensity (practical range: 0-1).
sharpness: Number - Noise sharpness (practical range: 0-20).
grainSize: Number - Grain size (practical range: 1-8).
intensityX0: Number - X0 noise intensity (practical range: 0-5).
intensityX1: Number - X1 noise intensity (practical range: 0-5).
monochrome: Boolean - If set to true, applies monochromatic noise; false otherwise.

setShapeProperty.title: setShapeProperty
parameters: shape: String or Number - Either the index (in ListShapeFiles) or the shape path.
property: String - Shape property to modify.
value: Anything - Value to assign to shape property.
return_value: Boolean - If true then value was applied.

setSIDC.title: setSIDC
parameters: object: Object or Group - Data Type - Unit or group to set the symbol of.
sidc: String - Symbol Identification Code (SIDC) in string format. For empty characters, such as "SFGPUCI----D", use the dash / hyphen character.
return_value: Boolean - Returns true, if successfully applied; false, if not.

setSide.title: setSide
parameters: location: Location - Affected location.
side: Side-2 - Side to set (default: Unknown).

setSimulationMode.title: setSimulationMode
parameters: object: Object or Location (V1.50+) - Affected object.

mode: Number - Can be:0: Normal simulation mode.1: Visible and regular collisions, but no actions or animations, even if the unit is killed (objects can still be visibly destroyed).2: Invisible, no collisions. In V2.07+, mode 2 excludes the object from networking.
0: Normal simulation mode.
1: Visible and regular collisions, but no actions or animations, even if the unit is killed (objects can still be visibly destroyed).
2: Invisible, no collisions. In V2.07+, mode 2 excludes the object from networking.

setSimulationParameter.title: setSimulationParameter
parameters: object: Object
parameter: String - Parameter name, as listed in the description section.
value: Number - New value to apply to the object.

override: Boolean - If true, then the set value will permanently override the engine (e.g. the AI). If false, then then setting may only be temporary, should the engine decide to use a different value.

setSize.title: setSize
parameters: location: Location - Affected location.
size: Array  - [x, y], where width is 2 * x, the height is 2 * y (x and y are in meters).

setSkill.title: setSkill
parameters: unit: Object
level: Number - Range 0.01 to 1 (if set to 0, then it is bumped to .2, so use something like .01 to set it to the lowest possible value).

setSlideOnPush.title: setSlideOnPush
parameters: unit: Object - AI unit.
slide: Number - If 1, then the unit slides a bit to the side, when colliding with another unit. If set to 0, then the units stay on their path, even during collisions.

setSnowHeightArea.title: setSnowHeightArea
setSnowHeightArea.docSyntax: setSnowHeightArea [pos1, pos2, height, changeLower, changeHigher, network]
parameters: pos1: Position-2 - Lower left position of area to change.
pos2: Position-2 - Upper right position of area to change.
height: Number - New snow height as PositionASL.

changeLower: Boolean - If true, command will raise snow that is lower than the specified new height. If false, only higher snow levels will be lowered. The changeLower option does not consider snow levels that have been modified by either this command, setSnowHeightRadius, or setBiotope (optional, default: true).

changeHigher: Boolean - If true, command will lower snow that is higher than the specified new height. If false, only lower snow levels will be raised. The changeHigher option does not consider snow levels that have been modified by either this command, setSnowHeightRadius, or setBiotope (optional, default: true).
network: Boolean - If true, then changes are propagated through the network. If false, then the changes are local (optional, default: false).

setSnowHeightRadius.title: setSnowHeightRadius
parameters: pos1: Position-2 - Center of area to modify.
radius: Number - Radius around the center, which is affected.
centerHeight: Number - Height modification at the center of the circle (positive values increase the snow height, negative values decrease it).

edgeHeight: Number - Height modification at the edge of the circle. While the ultimate edge of the affected area is always on the same level as the original terrain, the difference between edgeHeight and centerHeight determines how steep the drop-off is at the edges (see examples below).
network: Boolean - If true, then changes are propagated through the network. If false, then change is local (optional, default: false).

setSoundEffect.title: setSoundEffect
parameters: trigger: Object - Affected trigger.
sound: String - Name of sound.
voice: String - Name of voice.
soundEnv: String - Name of an environmental sound from CfgEnvSounds (see Class CfgEnvSounds in the VBS3 Developer Reference).
soundDet: String - Name of the dynamic sound object to create and attach to a trigger, defined in CfgSFX (see Class CfgSFX in the VBS3 Developer Reference).

setSoundSourceAmbient.title: setSoundSourceAmbient
parameters: sound: Object - Sound source object.
ambient: Boolean - If true, then sound is ambient.

setSoundSourceAmplitude.title: setSoundSourceAmplitude
parameters: amplitude: Number - Sound amplitude.

setSoundSourceDistance.title: setSoundSourceDistance
parameters: source : Object - Sound source.
distance: Number - Audible distance. If < 0.1 then the default distance of 1,000m is used.

setSoundSourceVolume.title: setSoundSourceVolume
parameters: sound : Object - Sound source created, using createSoundSource.
volume: Number - Volume (0-1).

setSpeedMode.title: setSpeedMode
parameters: group: Object or Group - Affected group.
mode: String -  Mode may be one of:"LIMITED" (half speed)"NORMAL" (full speed, maintain formation)"FULL" (do not wait for any other units in formation)
"LIMITED" (half speed)
"NORMAL" (full speed, maintain formation)
"FULL" (do not wait for any other units in formation)

setStructureGroup.title: setStructureGroup
parameters: grp: Group - Group to modify.
isSG: Boolean - If true, then the group becomes a Structure Group.

setSubstitutedSound.title: setSubstitutedSound
parameters: target: String - Path to the sound file, which is substituted. The target path is not specific to case sensitivity and leading slash. Drive letters in the path are ignored by the engine.
source: String - Path to the sound file, which is used instead.
pitch: Number - Pitch of the substituted sound (does not have effect).
db: Number - Volume of the substituted sound in dB (does not have effect).
ad: Number - Audible distance of the substituted sound in meters (does not have effect).

setSurfaceDrainage.title: setSurfaceDrainage
parameters: drainage: Number - How fast soil loses water from drainage (in mm/h) (default: 4).

setSurfaceMoisture.title: setSurfaceMoisture
parameters: moisture: Number - How much water (in mm) is in soil (range: 0-100).

setSurveillanceMode.title: setSurveillanceMode
parameters: vehicle: Object - Vehicle with turrets.
turret: Array - Path of turret to control.
mode: Boolean - If true, then only optics are moved. If false, then turret is moves as well.

axes: Array - Overrides mode, and contains [horizontal, vertical] (optional, default: [true, true]):horizontal: Boolean - If true, then horizontal optics movements do not affect the turret direction. If false, then turret moves as well.vertical: Boolean - If true, then vertical optics movements do not affect the turret direction. If false, then turret moves as well.
horizontal: Boolean - If true, then horizontal optics movements do not affect the turret direction. If false, then turret moves as well.
vertical: Boolean - If true, then vertical optics movements do not affect the turret direction. If false, then turret moves as well.

setSyncSceneProperty.title: setSyncSceneProperty
parameters: property: String - Scene property to synchronize. Can be:"Date""Declination""Fog""MaxEvaporation""MaxRainDensity""Overcast""Rain""RandomWeather""SurfaceDrainage""SurfaceMoisture""WaterLevel""WaterOpacity""Wind"
"Date"
"Declination"
"Fog"
"MaxEvaporation"
"MaxRainDensity"
"Overcast"
"Rain"
"RandomWeather"
"SurfaceDrainage"
"SurfaceMoisture"
"WaterLevel"
"WaterOpacity"
"Wind"
sync: Boolean - If true, then the scene property is synchronized.

setTargetAge.title: setTargetAge
parameters: object: Object
age: String - Target age. Can be: "ACTUAL", "5 MIN", "10 MIN", "15 MIN", "30 MIN", "60 MIN", "120 MIN", or "UNKNOWN".

setTerrainGrid.title: setTerrainGrid
parameters: grid: Number - Grid resolution.

setTerrainHeight.title: setTerrainHeight
parameters: x: Number - X-coordinate of cell to change.
y: Number - Y-coordinate of cell to change.
z: Number - New ASL height of cell.
fastSnowGen: Boolean - If true, segments generation does not have to wait for snow (optional, default: false) (V3.8+).
affectRivers: Boolean - Determines whether terrain (false) or river (true) heights should be modified (pptional, default: false) (V3.8+).

setTerrainHeightArea.title: setTerrainHeightArea
setTerrainHeightArea.docSyntax: setTerrainHeightArea [pos1, pos2, height, changeLower, changeHigher, affectRivers]
parameters: pos1: Position-2 - Lower-left position of area to change.
pos2: Position-2 - Upper-right position of area to change.
height: Number - New terrain height as PositionASL.
changeLower: Boolean - If true, the command raises the terrain that is lower than the specified new height. If false, only higher terrain is lowered (optional, default: true).
changeHigher: Boolean - If true, command lowers the terrain that is higher than the specified new height. If false, only lower terrain is raised (optional, default: true).
affectRivers: Boolean - Determines whether terrain (false) or river (true) heights should be modified (optional, default: false) (V3.8+).

setText.title: setText
parameters: location: Location - Text location.
text: String - Text to display.

setThermalParameters.title: setThermalParameters
parameters: world: String - Must be world, for use with the following parameters.
air: Number - Air temperature (practical range: -30 to 60).
black: Number - Temperature delta for black surfaces.
white: Number - Temperature delta for white surfaces.

setThrustLWanted.title: setThrustLWanted
parameters: vehicle : Object - Controlled vehicle.
factor: Number - Thrust factor.

setThrustRWanted.title: setThrustRWanted
parameters: vehicle : Object - Controlled vehicle.
factor: Number - Thrust factor.

setThrustWanted.title: setThrustWanted
parameters: vehicle : Object - Controlled vehicle.
factor: Number - Thrust factor.

setTIAutoBC.title: setTIAutoBC
parameters: enable: Boolean - Set automatic mode for both brightness and contrast (default: true).

setTIAutoBCBrightnessCoef.title: setTIAutoBCBrightnessCoef
parameters: offset: Number - Brightness correction value, in the range of 0.1 - 5.

setTIAutoBCContrastCoef.title: setTIAutoBCContrastCoef
parameters: contrast: Number - Contrast coefficient.

setTIAutoBCROI.title: setTIAutoBCROI
parameters: roi: Array - Rectangle ([left, right, top, bottom]) (optional, default for the whole screen: [0, 0, 1, 1]).

setTIBlurLevel.title: setTIBlurLevel
parameters: blurLevel: Number - Blur level.

setTIBrightness.title: setTIBrightness
parameters: brightness: Number - TI device brightness (in Celsius).

setTIContrast.title: setTIContrast
parameters: contrast: Number - TI contrast (in Celsius).

setTimelineExpansion.title: setTimelineExpansion
parameters: control: Control - Timeline dialog control.
size: Number - New width of control, if vertically oriented, height if horizontally oriented.

setTimelinePos.title: setTimelinePos
parameters: control: Control - Timeline dialog control.
pos: Number - Position the timeline is set to.

setTimelineRange.title: setTimelineRange
parameters: control: Control - Timeline dialog control.
fromTime: Number - Minimal time value (usually 0).
toTime: Number - Maximal time value (for example, length of the AAR loaded)/

setTimelineSelectionRange.title: setTimelineSelectionRange
parameters: control: Control - Timeline dialog control
fromTime: Number - Time of selection start,
toTime: Number - Time of selection end.

setTimelineViewAndPos.title: setTimelineViewAndPos
parameters: control: Control - Timeline dialog control
left: Number - Visible from.
pos: Number - Current position.
right: Number - Visible to.

setTimezoneOffset.title: setTimezoneOffset
parameters: value: Number - Offset in hours. Can be positive or negative, and be a decimal fraction.

setTIMode.title: setTIMode
parameters: mode: Number - TI Modes (0-7).

setTIOverride.title: setTIOverride
parameters: override: Boolean - If set to true, TI is forced; false otherwise.

setTitleEffect.title: setTitleEffect
parameters: trigger: Object - Trigger the title is associated with.

type: String - Can be:"NONE" - No effect is applied."OBJECT" - The text parameter defines the shown object, a subclass of CfgTitles."RES" - The text parameter defines a resource class, a subclass of RscTitles."TEXT" - The text parameter is shown as the text itself.
"NONE" - No effect is applied.
"OBJECT" - The text parameter defines the shown object, a subclass of CfgTitles.
"RES" - The text parameter defines a resource class, a subclass of RscTitles.
"TEXT" - The text parameter is shown as the text itself.
effect: String - Defines the effect sub-type: "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT", or "WHITE IN".
text: String - Title text.

setTowParent.title: setTowParent
parameters: vehicle1 : Object - Vehicle that is being towed.
vehicle2 : Object - Vehicle that is towing vehicle1. If set to objNull, automatic steering / braking is disabled.

setTraining.title: setTraining
parameters: unit: Object - Affected unit.
rating: Number - Training rating.

setTriggerActivation.title: setTriggerActivation
parameters: trigger: Object - Trigger object.

by: String - Who activates trigger. Can be:"NONE"Side-related - "EAST", "WEST", "GUER", "CIV", "LOGIC", "ANY".Radio-related - "ALPHA", "BRAVO", "CHARLIE", "DELTA", "ECHO", "FOXTROT", "GOLF", "HOTEL", "INDIA", "JULIET".Object-related - "STATIC", "VEHICLE", "GROUP", "LEADER", "MEMBER".Status-related - "WEST SEIZED", "EAST SEIZED", "GUER SEIZED".
"NONE"
Side-related - "EAST", "WEST", "GUER", "CIV", "LOGIC", "ANY".
Radio-related - "ALPHA", "BRAVO", "CHARLIE", "DELTA", "ECHO", "FOXTROT", "GOLF", "HOTEL", "INDIA", "JULIET".
Object-related - "STATIC", "VEHICLE", "GROUP", "LEADER", "MEMBER".
Status-related - "WEST SEIZED", "EAST SEIZED", "GUER SEIZED".
type: String - How the trigger is it activated. Can be:Presence-related - "PRESENT", "NOT PRESENT".Detection-related - "WEST D", "EAST D", "GUER D", "CIV D".
Presence-related - "PRESENT", "NOT PRESENT".
Detection-related - "WEST D", "EAST D", "GUER D", "CIV D".
repeating: Boolean - Activation can happen repeatedly.

setTriggerActivationEH.title: setTriggerActivationEH
parameters: trigger: Object - Activated trigger.
script: String - SQF script to execute.

setTriggerArea.title: setTriggerArea
parameters: trigger: Object - Trigger object.
xrad: Number - Horizontal (x) radius (or half the width of a rectangle).
yrad: Number - Vertical (Y) radius (or half the height of a rectangle).
angle: Number - Rotation angle (in degrees).
rectangle: Boolean - Set to true for rectangle, false for circle.

setTriggerAreaPolygonal.title: setTriggerAreaPolygonal
parameters: trigger: Object - Trigger object.
points: Array of Position-2 - Polygon definition (see description). Must be at lease 3 points, otherwise the command is not executed.
absolute: Boolean - If true, then the points define the absolute map positions; if false, then they are relative to the current position of the trigger.

setTriggerForm.title: setTriggerForm
parameters: trigger: Trigger
form: String - Form name (form's file name without extension)

setTriggerStatements.title: setTriggerStatements
parameters: trigger: Object - Trigger object.
condition: String - Code containing the trigger condition, which has to return a Boolean value. If this is used, the result of the trigger setTriggerActivation is interpreted.
activation: String - Code that is executed, when the trigger is activated (the variable this contains an array with the units that activated the trigger).
deactivation: String - Code that is executed, when the trigger is deactivated.

setTriggerText.title: setTriggerText
parameters: trigger: Object - Affected trigger.
text: String - Text label to attach.

setTriggerTimeout.title: setTriggerTimeout
parameters: trigger: Object - Affected trigger.
min: Number - Minimum time.
mid: Number - Middle time.
max: Number - Maximum time.
interruptable: Boolean - If set to true, the trigger condition must be fulfilled all the time.

setTriggerType.title: setTriggerType
parameters: trigger: Object - Affected trigger.
action: String - Action type.

setTurnWanted.title: setTurnWanted
parameters: vehicle: Object - Controlled vehicle.
factor: Number - Factor to change the wanted turn of the vehicle.

setTurretMaster.title: setTurretMaster
parameters: master: Object - Vehicle whose direction should be matched (empty to cancel matching).

source: String or Array - Position in master vehicle to match. Either "driver" or a turret path. If source is a turret, or the freeLook option is enabled, then the vertical direction is matched as well (within the limitations of the slave turret) (empty to cancel matching).
slave: Object - Vehicle (with turret) that should match the source direction.
turret: Array - Turret to which apply the source direction.
freeLook: Boolean - If true, then the source free-look direction is used.
priority: Number - If multiple sources are defined, then the one with the highest priority is used (optional, default: 0).

setTurretStabilization.title: setTurretStabilization
parameters: vehicle : Object - Vehicle with turret.
turret: Array - Turret to stabilize.
horizontal: Boolean - If true, then the horizontal axis is stabilized.
vertical: Boolean - If true, then the vertical axis is stabilized.

setType.title: setType
parameters: location: Location - Affected location.
name: String - Location class / type.

setUnconscious.title: setUnconscious
parameters: object: Unit - Affected unit.
state: Boolean - If true, then certain skills are disabled (see description).

setUnitAbility.title: setUnitAbility
parameters: unit: Object - Affected unit.
skill: Number - Skill in the range of 0.2 - 1.0.

setUnitBehaviour.title: setUnitBehaviour
parameters: unit: Object - Unit to which the behavior is applied.
behavior: String - Behavior applied to unit. Can be:"CARELESS""SAFE""AWARE""COMBAT""STEALTH"
"CARELESS"
"SAFE"
"AWARE"
"COMBAT"
"STEALTH"
return_value: Boolean - Returns true, if behavior is applied successfully; otherwise false.

setUnitBuoyancyOffset.title: setUnitBuoyancyOffset
parameters: unit: Object - Player or AI unit to affect.
offset: Number - Vertical offset (in meters). The higher the offset, the higher the unit floats in the water.

setUnitCombatMode.title: setUnitCombatMode
parameters: unit: Object - Unit to which combat mode is applied.
mode: String - Combat mode applied to the unit. Can be:"BLUE" (Never fire)"GREEN" (Hold fire - defend only)"WHITE" (Hold fire, engage at will)"YELLOW" (Open fire)"RED" (Open fire, engage at will)
"BLUE" (Never fire)
"GREEN" (Hold fire - defend only)
"WHITE" (Hold fire, engage at will)
"YELLOW" (Open fire)
"RED" (Open fire, engage at will)
return_value: Boolean - Returns true, if the combat mode is applied successfully; otherwise, false.

setUnitName.title: setUnitName
parameters: unit: Object - Affected unit.
name: String - Unit name.

setUnitPos.title: setUnitPos
parameters: unit: Object - Affected unit.

mode: String - Position mode. Can be:"DOWN" - Unit goes prone and stays prone."UP" - Unit stands and stays standing."MIDDLE" - Kneeling position (unit does not kneel, if it does not have a rifle)."AUTO" - Unit chooses any of the other modes, according to circumstances.
"DOWN" - Unit goes prone and stays prone.
"UP" - Unit stands and stays standing.
"MIDDLE" - Kneeling position (unit does not kneel, if it does not have a rifle).
"AUTO" - Unit chooses any of the other modes, according to circumstances.

setUnitPosWeak.title: setUnitPosWeak
parameters: unit: Object - Affected unit.

mode: String - Position mode. Can be:"DOWN" - Unit goes prone and stays prone."UP" - Unit stands and stays standing."Middle" - Kneeling Positioning (ArmA version 1.04)."AUTO" - Unit chooses any of the other modes, according to circumstances.
"DOWN" - Unit goes prone and stays prone.
"UP" - Unit stands and stays standing.
"Middle" - Kneeling Positioning (ArmA version 1.04).
"AUTO" - Unit chooses any of the other modes, according to circumstances.

setUnitRank.title: setUnitRank
parameters: unit: Object - Affected unit.
rank: String - Unit rank.

setUnitRecoilCoefficient.title: setUnitRecoilCoefficient
parameters: recoil: Number - Recoil strength. Realistic values are: ~20 for handguns, ~100 for rifles (0: no recoil).

setUserChart.title: setUserChart
parameters: chart: String - Path to custom texture.

setUserChartDrawObjects.title: setUserChartDrawObjects
parameters: drawObjects: Boolean - If true, then the map objects are visible; false otherwise.

setVariable.title: setVariable
setVariable.docSyntax: element setVariable [name, value, public, resetOnRespawn, recordForAAR]
parameters: element: Anything - Entity to assign a variable to (see description for compatible types).
name: String - Name of variable (case-sensitive).
value: Anything - Value to assign to variable (see Notes under recordForAAR for limitations).
public: Boolean - If true, then the value is broadcast to all computers (works with Object, Group, and Waypoint). Generates a syntax error, if used with Namespace (optional, default: false).
resetOnRespawn: Boolean - Clear variable on respawn (optional, default: false) (V2.03+).

recordForAAR: Boolean - Whether the variable should be available in AAR. If true, then element can only be an Object, and value can only contain String, Number, Array, or a combination of these (optional, default: false) (V3.4+).

setVectorDir.title: setVectorDir
parameters: vehicle: Object - Object that vector is applied to.
vectorDir: Array - Direction vector applied to object.
relative: Boolean - Specifies if the vectors are relative to parent (optional, default: false) (V1.30+).

setVectorDirAndUp.title: setVectorDirAndUp
parameters: vehicle: Object - Object that the vectors are applied to.
vectorDir: Array - Direction vector applied to the object.
vectorUp: Array - Up vector applied to the object.
relative: Boolean - Specifies if the vectors are relative to parent (optional, default: false) (V1.30+).

setVectorUp.title: setVectorUp
parameters: object: Object - Affected object.
[x, z, y]: Array - Up vector.

setVehicleAmmo.title: setVehicleAmmo
parameters: vehicle: Object - Vehicle or unit.
value: Number - Relative ammunition range between 0 (empty) - 1 (full).

setVehicleArmor.title: setVehicleArmor
parameters: object: Object - Vehicle or unit.
value: Number - Armor state / health, in the range of 0 (destroyed / dead) - 1 (full).

setVehicleId.title: setVehicleId
parameters: vehicleName: Object
id: Number

setVehicleInit.title: setVehicleInit
parameters: unit: Object - Affected unit.
statement: String - SQF statement.

setVehicleLaseTarget.title: setVehicleLaseTarget
parameters: shooter: Object - Vehicle or unit.
target: Object - Vehicle of the opposing side.

setVehicleLights.title: setVehicleLights
setVehicleLights.docSyntax: car setVehicleLights [main, side, convoy, left, right, blackout]
parameters: car: Object - Ground vehicle.
main: Number - Driving lights (head lights, rear lights and brake lights).
side: Number - Side lights (small edge indicator lights - only available on some vehicles).
convoy: Number - White rear light for convoy driving (only available on some vehicles). Activating the convoy light disables driving and indicator lights while on.
left: Number - Left turn signal.
right: Number - Right turn signal.
blackout: Number - Blackout lights (if the vehicle is equipped with them) (optional, default: 0) (V3.2+)

setVehicleLock.title: setVehicleLock
parameters: vehicle: Object - Affected vehicle.
state: String - Lock state. Can be: "UNLOCKED", "DEFAULT", or "LOCKED"

setVehicleLockTarget.title: setVehicleLockTarget
parameters: unit: Object - Unit, or vehicle with lockable weapon (can only be assigned to the vehicle itself, but not to a specific crew member of that vehicle).
target: Object - Object to target. Use objNull to cancel targeting.

setVehiclePosition.title: setVehiclePosition
parameters: object: Object - Affected object.
position: Position-2 - Candidate position to move the object to.
markers: Position-2 - Other candidate positions to move the object to.
placement: Number

setVehicleTiPars.title: setVehicleTiPars
parameters: vehicle: Object - Vehicle whose components are manipulated.
engine: Number - TI heat for engine and body (0: cold, 1: hot).
wheels: Number - TI heat for tracks or wheels (0: cold, 1: hot).
weapon: Number - TI heat for main weapon (0: cold, 1: hot).

setVehicleTracks.title: setVehicleTracks
parameters: vehicle: Object - Affected tracked vehicle.
standard: Boolean - Enable / disable standard tracks.
custom: Boolean - Enable / disable custom tracks.
texture: String - Texture for custom tracks (as an absolute path),

setVehicleVarName.title: setVehicleVarName
parameters: object: Object - Affected object.
name: String - Variable name.

setVelocity.title: setVelocity
parameters: vehicle: Object - Affected vehicle.
velocity: Vector3D - Velocity in [x, y ,z] (in V2.15+, [0,0,0] stops the vehicle).

setVelocityAng.title: setVelocityAng
parameters: vehicle: Object - Affected vehicle.

velocity: Vector3D - Change of direction for [x, y, z] in m/sec:For x (pitch), positive means down, negative means up.For y (roll), positive means left, negative means right.For z (yaw), positive means left, negative means right.
For x (pitch), positive means down, negative means up.
For y (roll), positive means left, negative means right.
For z (yaw), positive means left, negative means right.

setVelocityTransformation.title: setVelocityTransformation
setVelocityTransformation.docSyntax: object setVelocityTransformation [pos1, pos2, vel1, vel2, dir1, dir2, up1, up2, interval]
parameters: object: Object - Object to position.
pos1: PositionASL - ASL position of first reference object.
pos2: PositionASL - ASL position of second reference object.
vel1: Vector3D - velocity of first reference object.
vel2: Vector3D - velocity of second reference object.
dir1: Vector3D - vectorDir of first reference object.
dir2: Vector3D - vectorDir of second reference object.
up1: Vector3D - vectorUp of first reference object.
up2: Vector3D - vectorUp of second reference object.
interval: Number - Relative position between the two reference objects, where the manipulated object is placed at (0-1).

setVideoSetting.title: setVideoSetting
parameters: option: String - Supported options:"objectDetail": (0-4) (V1.23+)"objectDrawDistance": (500-10000) (V1.23+)"postprocessDetail": (0-2) (V1.67+, but not V.2.00+)"screenResolution": Followed by two parameters: width, height. Supported only in full-screen mode, and only for supported resolutions. List of supported resolutions is provided by getSupportedResolutions (V1.48+). In V2.05+, two more parameters can be defined: width, height, render percentage, windowed. Render percentage defines the rendering resolution in relation to the screen resolution - for example, [1280,720,50,true] sets up a 1280x720 windowed mode with a rendering resolution of 640x360. Possible percentages are 50, 67, 75, 80, 83, 88, 100, 114, 120, 125, 133, 150, and 200; windowed defines whether the display is shown in windowed or full-screen mode. Windowed screen resolutions can be anything, and are not restricted to getSupportedResolutions. Does not automatically adjust the aspect ratio, if the new resolution requires that."shadingDetail": (0-4) (V1.67+, but not V.2.00+)"shadowDetail": (0-4) (V1.67+, but not V.2.00+)"shadowDistance": Maximum shadow distance."shadowsCamHeightCoef": Computing the shadows drawing distance from the camera height above the ground. Draw distance is calculated as height * shadowsCamHeightCoef (V1.31+). "terrainDetail": (0-4) (V1.67+, but not V.2.00+)"viewDistance": (10-10000 in V1.23+), (500-10000 in V3.6+) In V3.2+, all video settings from the options dialog can be defined using the command. If setViewDistance is already used, viewDistance does not have any effect (in single-player and multiplayer)."anisotropicFiltering" (0,1,2,3,4)"AToC" (0,1,2,3)"blood" (0,1,2)"bloom" (0,1)"brightness" (0.5 - 1.5)"caustics" (0,1,2)"depthOfField": Depth of Field (0,1,2)"dynamicObjectViewDistance" (0,1)"dynamicViewDistance" (0,1)"fsaa" (0,1,2...) (depends on video card)"gamma" (0.5 - 2.0) (only has an effect in full-screen mode)"godrays": Crepuscular rays (0,1)"hdrquality" (0,1,2)"motionBlur" (0,1)"objectsDetail" (0,1,2,3,4)"particleQuality": Particle Effects Detail (0,1,2),"ppaa": Postprocess Antialiasing (0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8)"rttCount" (0,1,2,3)"rttQuality" (0,1,2,3)"sceneDetail" (0,1,2,3,4)"scriptedPostProcess" (0,1)"shadowQuality" (0,1,2,3)"ssao": Screen space ambient occlusion (0,1,2,3)"terrainDetail" (0,1,2,3,4)"textureQuality" (0,1,2,3)"videoMemory" (0,1,2,3,4)"vsync" (0,1), V3.4+: (0,1,2)"waterReflections" (0,1,2,3,4) In V3.6+, the following settings have been added:"damageCharring" (0,1): Darkening of vehicle parts that are damaged (or the whole vehicle if no sub-systems are defined)."vehComplexityScale": Used for managing vehicle LOD rendering. The higher the value, the greater the complexity of the vehicle compared to other objects. Values < 1 cause lower LODs to be displayed. Values > 1 cause lower LODs to be displayed at a bigger distance from the camera (default: 1, V3.8.1+)."maxMapObjectLOD": Allows the user to specify the best LOD used for map objects (default: 0, no limitation) (V17.2.0+)."particleDensity": Affects the amount of particles generated by particle sources. When set to 1, no change is applied. When set, for example, to 2, the amount of generated particles is doubled. If set to 0.5, only half of the particles is being generated (the minimum value is 0.01) (V17.2.0+)."particleDrawDistance": Can be used to modify the maximum distance from the camera, where the particles are created. When this option is not set, or is set to a negative value, object draw distance is used instead (the option value is used only if it is set to 0 or above). Particle Draw Distance is not limited by ObjectDraw Distance. After changing ObjectDraw Distance ParticleDraw Distance get reseted. (20.2+)
"objectDetail": (0-4) (V1.23+)
"objectDrawDistance": (500-10000) (V1.23+)
"postprocessDetail": (0-2) (V1.67+, but not V.2.00+)

"screenResolution": Followed by two parameters: width, height. Supported only in full-screen mode, and only for supported resolutions. List of supported resolutions is provided by getSupportedResolutions (V1.48+). In V2.05+, two more parameters can be defined: width, height, render percentage, windowed. Render percentage defines the rendering resolution in relation to the screen resolution - for example, [1280,720,50,true] sets up a 1280x720 windowed mode with a rendering resolution of 640x360. Possible percentages are 50, 67, 75, 80, 83, 88, 100, 114, 120, 125, 133, 150, and 200; windowed defines whether the display is shown in windowed or full-screen mode. Windowed screen resolutions can be anything, and are not restricted to getSupportedResolutions. Does not automatically adjust the aspect ratio, if the new resolution requires that.
"shadingDetail": (0-4) (V1.67+, but not V.2.00+)
"shadowDetail": (0-4) (V1.67+, but not V.2.00+)
"shadowDistance": Maximum shadow distance.
"shadowsCamHeightCoef": Computing the shadows drawing distance from the camera height above the ground. Draw distance is calculated as height * shadowsCamHeightCoef (V1.31+).
"terrainDetail": (0-4) (V1.67+, but not V.2.00+)

"viewDistance": (10-10000 in V1.23+), (500-10000 in V3.6+) In V3.2+, all video settings from the options dialog can be defined using the command. If setViewDistance is already used, viewDistance does not have any effect (in single-player and multiplayer).
"anisotropicFiltering" (0,1,2,3,4)
"bloom" (0,1)
"brightness" (0.5 - 1.5)
"caustics" (0,1,2)
"depthOfField": Depth of Field (0,1,2)
"dynamicObjectViewDistance" (0,1)
"dynamicViewDistance" (0,1)
"fsaa" (0,1,2...) (depends on video card)
"gamma" (0.5 - 2.0) (only has an effect in full-screen mode)
"godrays": Crepuscular rays (0,1)
"hdrquality" (0,1,2)
"motionBlur" (0,1)
"objectsDetail" (0,1,2,3,4)
"particleQuality": Particle Effects Detail (0,1,2),
"ppaa": Postprocess Antialiasing (0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8)
"rttCount" (0,1,2,3)
"rttQuality" (0,1,2,3)
"sceneDetail" (0,1,2,3,4)
"scriptedPostProcess" (0,1)
"shadowQuality" (0,1,2,3)
"ssao": Screen space ambient occlusion (0,1,2,3)
"terrainDetail" (0,1,2,3,4)
"textureQuality" (0,1,2,3)
"videoMemory" (0,1,2,3,4)
"waterReflections" (0,1,2,3,4) In V3.6+, the following settings have been added:
"damageCharring" (0,1): Darkening of vehicle parts that are damaged (or the whole vehicle if no sub-systems are defined).

"vehComplexityScale": Used for managing vehicle LOD rendering. The higher the value, the greater the complexity of the vehicle compared to other objects. Values < 1 cause lower LODs to be displayed. Values > 1 cause lower LODs to be displayed at a bigger distance from the camera (default: 1, V3.8.1+).
"maxMapObjectLOD": Allows the user to specify the best LOD used for map objects (default: 0, no limitation) (V17.2.0+).

"particleDensity": Affects the amount of particles generated by particle sources. When set to 1, no change is applied. When set, for example, to 2, the amount of generated particles is doubled. If set to 0.5, only half of the particles is being generated (the minimum value is 0.01) (V17.2.0+).

"particleDrawDistance": Can be used to modify the maximum distance from the camera, where the particles are created. When this option is not set, or is set to a negative value, object draw distance is used instead (the option value is used only if it is set to 0 or above). Particle Draw Distance is not limited by ObjectDraw Distance. After changing ObjectDraw Distance ParticleDraw Distance get reseted. (20.2+)

value: Number - One or more values, depending on option. The possible values listed correspond to the options of the in-game drop-down menus (for example, "blood" (0,1,2) corresponds to ("disabled", "low", "high")).

setViewDistance.title: setViewDistance
parameters: distance: Number - Distance in meters. The accepted range is: 10 - 10000.

setViewPar.title: setViewPar
parameters: type: String - Can be:"contour" - Controls elevation lines (applied to editor map and user maps)."grid" - Controls grid (applied to editor map and user maps)."hit" - Controls bullet paths (only applies to AAR)."texture" - Controls texture image - true hides the texture, false displays it (applied to the map control passed through object) (obsolete in V3.6+, replaced by "backgroundMode")"textureonly" - Controls texture detail in RTE map. true shows only the texture bitmap; hiding building footprints, map icons (for example, for trees), map names, markers, units, and waypoints (V2.05+)"trail" - Controls movement trails. If used with 3rd argument, only applies setting to that object."backgroundMode" - Switches between different background modes. Values for this option are: "none", "satelliteMap" or "shadedRelief" (V3.6+)
"contour" - Controls elevation lines (applied to editor map and user maps).
"grid" - Controls grid (applied to editor map and user maps).
"hit" - Controls bullet paths (only applies to AAR).
"texture" - Controls texture image - true hides the texture, false displays it (applied to the map control passed through object) (obsolete in V3.6+, replaced by "backgroundMode")

"textureonly" - Controls texture detail in RTE map. true shows only the texture bitmap; hiding building footprints, map icons (for example, for trees), map names, markers, units, and waypoints (V2.05+)
"trail" - Controls movement trails. If used with 3rd argument, only applies setting to that object.
"backgroundMode" - Switches between different background modes. Values for this option are: "none", "satelliteMap" or "shadedRelief" (V3.6+)
value: Boolean or String (only for "backgroundMode").
object: Control or Object - Optional, only for type "texture" or "trail".

setWaypointTimeout.title: setWaypointTimeout
parameters: waypoint: Waypoint - Affected waypoint.

mid: Number - Medium / average time between condition satisfaction and waypoint completion.
max: Number - Maximum time between condition satisfaction and waypoint completion.

setWaypointType.title: setWaypointType
parameters: waypoint: Waypoint

type: String - For the full list of waypoint types available in your version of VBS, see Appendix 1 - Waypoint Types in the VBS3 Editor Manual. Waypoint types include the following:"MOVE": Group moves to the specified location."GETIN": Group mounts a vehicle."JOIN": Group merges with other group (which becomes the leader)."LEADER": Group merges with other group (and become the leader)."GETOUT": Group dismounts from a vehicle."CYCLE": The nearest group waypoint becomes the current group waypoint."LOAD": Vehicle loads nearby units."UNLOAD": Group members in cargo are unloaded from the vehicle."TR UNLOAD": Units in cargo (which are of a different group) are unloaded from the vehicle."HOLD": Group stays at a position, until the waypoint type is switched, using an SQF script."SENTRY": Group stays at the waypoint, until it has identified any present enemies."GUARD": Used in conjunction with "Guarded by" triggers, to protect a specified area."TALK": Group leader moves its lips, and voices any phrases selected in the "Effects" section."SCRIPTED": Defined script is executed, and group skips to the next waypoint."GETIN NEAREST": Group mounts a vehicle that is within 50m."DISMISS": Groups split and move in random directions."LAND": Aircraft land at the nearest possible position."LOITER": Aircraft fly in circles around the waypoint (requires setWaypointLoiterType definition)."TAXI": Maneuver the aircraft to / from runway / helipad."RETREAT": AI prioritize moving over anything else (similar to fleeing), but do so under the same conditions as Combat behavior with a Move waypoint (V3.8+)."AND": Waypoint is only completed, if all synchronized GameLogic waypoints return true."OR": waypoint is completed, if any of the synchronized GameLogic waypoints return true.
"MOVE": Group moves to the specified location.
"GETIN": Group mounts a vehicle.
"JOIN": Group merges with other group (which becomes the leader).
"LEADER": Group merges with other group (and become the leader).
"GETOUT": Group dismounts from a vehicle.
"CYCLE": The nearest group waypoint becomes the current group waypoint.
"LOAD": Vehicle loads nearby units.
"UNLOAD": Group members in cargo are unloaded from the vehicle.
"TR UNLOAD": Units in cargo (which are of a different group) are unloaded from the vehicle.
"HOLD": Group stays at a position, until the waypoint type is switched, using an SQF script.
"SENTRY": Group stays at the waypoint, until it has identified any present enemies.
"GUARD": Used in conjunction with "Guarded by" triggers, to protect a specified area.
"TALK": Group leader moves its lips, and voices any phrases selected in the "Effects" section.
"SCRIPTED": Defined script is executed, and group skips to the next waypoint.
"GETIN NEAREST": Group mounts a vehicle that is within 50m.
"DISMISS": Groups split and move in random directions.
"LAND": Aircraft land at the nearest possible position.
"LOITER": Aircraft fly in circles around the waypoint (requires setWaypointLoiterType definition).
"TAXI": Maneuver the aircraft to / from runway / helipad.
"RETREAT": AI prioritize moving over anything else (similar to fleeing), but do so under the same conditions as Combat behavior with a Move waypoint (V3.8+).
"AND": Waypoint is only completed, if all synchronized GameLogic waypoints return true.
"OR": waypoint is completed, if any of the synchronized GameLogic waypoints return true.

turretPath: Array - The turret path of the specified weapon.
numberOfRounds: Number - The number of rounds to fire (there are normal reloading delays between rounds). A value of -1 causes the vehicle to fire until it goes out of

turretLockOn.title: turretLockOn
turretLockOn.docSyntax: vehicle turretLockOn [turretPath, target, trackMounted, trackHidden, keepLockWhenTrackingIsLost, updateRange]
parameters: vehicle: Object - Vehicle to lock.
turretPath: Array - Turret to lock.
target: PositionASL or Object - What to lock on. Locking can be reset by passing either a objNull or [0,0,0].
trackMounted: Boolean - Continue tracking the unit after entering a vehicle (optional, default: false) (V1.24+, no effect in VBS3).
trackHidden: Boolean / Number - Track the object, only if visible (Boolean), or visible enough (a Float number: 0-1) (optional, default: 1) (V1.24+, no effect in VBS3).
keepLockWhenTrackingIsLost: Boolean - Keep track of the object, even when it is out of turret limits (optional, default: true) (V1.24+, no effect in VBS3).
updateRange: Boolean - Match the FCS range, with distance to locked-on object (optional, default: true) (V18.2+).

underlyingSurface.title: underlyingSurface
parameters: position: PositionASL - The ASL2 position to examine.Tip: To detect any terrain surface faster, a negative Z-coordinate can be used in the position.Note: Care should be taken when using the Z-coordinate of the examined object. While it is possible to use the Z-coordinate of the object returned by getPosASL2, the results can be unexpected. This is because the object coordinates are not the same as the object center of gravity. The coordinate values, including the Z-coordinate, are set by the object (model) creator.
return_value: surfaceHeight: Number - ASL2 height of the nearest surface below the given position.
surfaceType: String - Surface type. Can be: "TERRAIN", "ROAD", "WATER", "ROADWAY", "OBJECT", "SNOW" (default: "OBJECT").
surfaceNormal: Vector3D - A vector defining the surfaceNormal for the detected surface.
surfaceObject: Object - The object the surface belongs to.

surfaceMaterial: Array - An array describing the material of the detected surface:impact: String - An attribute of the surface information .bisurf  file, defined in the .rvmat .soundEnviron: String - An attribute of the surface information .bisurf  file defined in the .rvmat .surfaceType: String - The surface type of a given terrain segment, if valid.roadType: String - The type of the detected road segment.
impact: String - An attribute of the surface information .bisurf  file, defined in the .rvmat .
soundEnviron: String - An attribute of the surface information .bisurf  file defined in the .rvmat .
surfaceType: String - The surface type of a given terrain segment, if valid.
roadType: String - The type of the detected road segment.

UPRDiscardRecording.title: UPRDiscardRecording
parameters: unit: Unit - Unit which is currently doing a UPRStartRecording, or whose recording has just been UPRStopRecording.
return_value: Boolean - If true, then recording was discarded. If false, then either the unit or the recording don't exist.

UPRGetMetaInfo.title: UPRGetMetaInfo
parameters: playback: String or Unit - Can be a path to a recording - either absolute or relative (in which case the command first looks in the mission folder, and then in %userprofile%\Documents\VBS3\RecordedPaths), or a unit that is currently UPRStartPlayback a recording.
return_value: startPosition: PositionASL - Initial position when recording was created.
startDirectionAside: Vector3D - Initial direction aside (vectorDir rotated 90º).
duration: Number - Length of recording (in sec).
map: String - worldName of map on which session was recorded.
unitClass: String - Class name of unit that was used for recording.
weapons: Array of String - List of weapons recording unit was equipped with.

UPRGetTimelineInfo.title: UPRGetTimelineInfo
parameters: playback: String or Unit - Can be a path to a recording - either absolute, or relative (in which case the command first looks in the mission folder, and then in %userprofile%\Documents\VBS3\RecordedPaths), or a unit that is currently UPRStartPlayback a recording.
time: Number - Time (in sec) into the recording, for which to return information.

UPRPlaybackUnits.title: UPRPlaybackUnits
return_value: Array of Unit - Units currently in playback mode, or an empty array.

UPRRecordingUnits.title: UPRRecordingUnits
return_value: Array of Unit - Units currently in recording mode, or an empty array.

UPRSaveRecording.title: UPRSaveRecording
parameters: unit: Unit - Player or AI unit which is currently recording (or whose recording has just been UPRStopRecording).

path: String - Path to save recording to. Can be either an absolute path (the directory must exist already), or a name (without an extension). If only the name is specified, then a time stamp (YYYY_MM_DD_hh_mm_ss) is inserted before the name, the worldName and the extension .upr are added, and the file will be saved to %userprofile%\Documents\VBS3\RecordedPaths.
return_value: String - The file name the recording was saved under (without any path information).If the recording couldn't be saved (e.g. wrong path info, or no recording present), then an empty string is returned.

UPRStartPlayback.title: UPRStartPlayback
parameters: unit: Unit - AI unit to replay recording.

recording: String - Path to recording. Can be either an absolute path, or a file name, in which case the command will first look in the mission folder, and then in %userprofile%\Documents\VBS3\RecordedPaths.
return_value: Boolean - If true, the playback was started. If false, then either the recording or the unit didn't exist (or was dead or amputated), and playback wasn't started.

UPRStartRecording.title: UPRStartRecording
parameters: unit: Unit - Player or AI unit.
return_value: Boolean - If true, then recording was started. If false, then no recording was started (either the unit is already recording, or doesn't exist).

UPRStopPlayback.title: UPRStopPlayback
parameters: unit: Unit - AI unit that is currently playing a UPR recording.
return_value: Boolean - If true, the playback was stopped. If false, then either the unit doesn't exist or it is not playing back anything.

UPRStopRecording.title: UPRStopRecording
parameters: unit: Unit - Player or AI unit which is currently recording its activities.
return_value: Boolean - If true, then recording was stopped. If false, then either the unit doesn't exist, or it isn't currently recording.
